original: 'dis ni de ni bya ba byas par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni de ni bya ba byas par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it has done its work.

original: skam sar gnas zhes pa ni skam sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: skam sar gnas zhes pa ni skam sa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: It is on dry land, on dry land means in nirvana,

original: bde ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the state of happiness.

original: de la gnas pa ni thams cad chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid la cher gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni thams cad chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dang / gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid la cher gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is on dry land because it is the nature of the Dharma body of all, and because it is the great state of the nondual reality.

original: ye shes 'ba' zhig las byung ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes 'ba' zhig las byung ba zhes pa ni /
translated: It is born of mere intuition,

original: de la 'ba' zhig ni dag pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'ba' zhig ni dag pa ste /
translated: mere means pure.

original: de 'byung ba 'ba' zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba 'ba' zhig pa'o //
translated: It is born of mere that.

original: de las skyes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is intuition born of that.

original: 'ba' zhig kyang de yin la ye shes kyang de yin pas ye shes 'ba' zhig kyang de'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig kyang de yin la ye shes kyang de yin pas ye shes 'ba' zhig kyang de'o //
translated: It is mere intuition, because it is mere and it is intuition.

original: de las skyes pa ni de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni de las byung ba ste /
translated: It is born of that, because it arises from that.

original: de de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: de de ltar gsungs so //
translated: It is taught as such.

original: shes rab mtshon chas rnam 'joms pa //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chas rnam 'joms pa // zhes pa ni /
translated: It is the destroyer of the army of demons with the weapon of wisdom.

original: de la shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de la shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: There, wisdom has the nature of the characteristic of the discernment of phenomena.

original: de nyid mtshan cha ste nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid mtshan cha ste nyon mongs pa thams cad gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the weapon of wisdom, because it cuts off all the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyi mtshon des chos thams cad la spong ba dang blang ba'i rnam par 'byed pa shes pas na de la de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mtshon des chos thams cad la spong ba dang blang ba'i rnam par 'byed pa shes pas na de la de ltar gsungs so //
translated: It is the knowledge of the discrimination of all things, because it discriminates the things to be rejected and the things to be adopted.

original: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
analyzed: dam chos chos rgyal gsal bar ldan //
translated: The Dharma of the Dharma King is clear.

original: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / ces pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i mchog / ces pa ste /
translated: It is the supreme illumination of the world.

original: de la dam pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la dam pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma of the Dharma King is twofold:

original: gtso bo ma yin pa dang gtso bo'o //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa dang gtso bo'o //
translated: the principal and the secondary.

original: de la dam pa rnam pa gnyis kyi chos ni dam pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de la dam pa rnam pa gnyis kyi chos ni dam pa'i chos te /
translated: The Dharma of the Dharma King is the Dharma of the two kinds of holy ones.

original: dam pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: dam pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The holy ones are the Buddhas and the Bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi chos ni gsung rab yan @60a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos ni gsung rab yan @60a * //
translated: Their Dharma is the twelve divisions of the scriptures.

original: lag bcu gnyis so //üîΩde la yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lag bcu gnyis so //üîΩde la yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The twelve divisions are:

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang // lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / chos rmad du byung ba'i sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang // lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang / skyes pa rabs kyi sde dang / chos rmad du byung ba'i sde dang /
translated: The branches are the scriptural collections of the sutras, the melodious expressions, the verses, the prophecies, the declarations, the narratives, the parables, the accounts of the Buddha's past lives, the marvelous events,üîΩthe extensive teachings, the established instructions, and the accounts of the Buddha's present and past deeds.

original: gling gzhi'i sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / gtan la phab pa'i sde dang / da ltar dang 'das pa'i sde zhes bya ba yan lag de rnams yi ge rab tu gsal bas glegs bam la gnas pa ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i chos so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gling gzhi'i sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / gtan la phab pa'i sde dang / da ltar dang 'das pa'i sde zhes bya ba yan lag de rnams yi ge rab tu gsal bas glegs bam la gnas pa ni gtso bo ma yin pa'i chos so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The scriptures with their clear letters are not the principal teachings.

original: gtso bo'i chos ni chos rgyal zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo'i chos ni chos rgyal zhes pa ste /
translated: The principal teachings are the Dharma King,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the ultimate realm is free from the expressed and the expresser.

original: de ni shes par byar med de /
analyzed: de ni shes par byar med de /
translated: It cannot be known.

original: 'di ltar shes rab sum brgya pa nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab sum brgya pa nas gsungs pa /
translated: As the Praj√±ƒÅ-s≈´tra says:

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni chos nyid lta //
translated: The Buddhas are like the nature of phenomena.

original: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
analyzed: 'dren pa rnams ni chos kyi sku //
translated: The Leaders are the Dharma Body.

original: chos nyid yang ni shes bya min //
analyzed: chos nyid yang ni shes bya min //
translated: The nature of phenomena is not known.

original: de ni shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: de ni shes par mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be known.

original: zhes so // de'i phyir na yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir na yang gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is also said:

original: gsal bar ldan zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsal bar ldan zhes pa ste /
translated: Endowed with clarity.

original: chos de gnyis ka yang ma rig pa'i phyi nang gi mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de gnyis ka yang ma rig pa'i phyi nang gi mun pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both of those phenomena remove the inner and outer darkness of ignorance.

original: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa rnams la ji ltar kun du gnas pa'i chos rab tu bstan pa'i phyir na 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pas bsgribs pa rnams la ji ltar kun du gnas pa'i chos rab tu bstan pa'i phyir na 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: The Illuminator of the World is for those obscured by the darkness of ignorance in the world, because it fully teaches the Dharma as it abides.

original: de yang mchog ste gtso bo ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mchog ste gtso bo ni bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
translated: And that is supreme, the principal one, that very BhagavƒÅn.

original: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
analyzed: chos kyi dbang phyug chos kyi rgyal //
translated: The Lord of Dharma, the King of Dharma,

original: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po //
translated: The Teacher of the Excellent Path.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is said:

original: de la chos kyi dbang phyug ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis chos rnams la dbang byed pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbang phyug ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyis chos rnams la dbang byed pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The Lord of Dharma is the Lord of Dharma because he has power over the dharmas of the path of the ten virtues.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩNot engaging in the ten non-virtues,üîΩalways engaging in virtue,

original: mi dge bcu la mi 'jug dang // rtag tu dge la rab tu 'jug / sems kyi las dang lus ngag gi / chos 'di rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: mi dge bcu la mi 'jug dang // rtag tu dge la rab tu 'jug / sems kyi las dang lus ngag gi / chos 'di rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: the mental action and the physical and verbal actions,üîΩthese are considered the three aspects of Dharma.

original: ces so // chos kyi rgyal ni phyi nang gsang ba'i theg pa rnam pa gsum du dbye bas phye ba'i chos kyi rgyal po bas chos kyi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: ces so // chos kyi rgyal ni phyi nang gsang ba'i theg pa rnam pa gsum du dbye bas phye ba'i chos kyi rgyal po bas chos kyi rgyal po'o //
translated: The King of Dharma is the King of Dharma because he is the king of the Dharma that is distinguished by being divided into the three aspects of the outer, inner, and secret vehicles.

original: legs pa'i lam ston pa po ni legs pa nyid kyi lam ni legs pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: legs pa'i lam ston pa po ni legs pa nyid kyi lam ni legs pa'i lam ste /
translated: The Teacher of the Good Path is the Teacher of the Good Path.

original: de so sor sgrub par byed pa'i chos ni legs pa'i lam du gsungs so //
analyzed: de so sor sgrub par byed pa'i chos ni legs pa'i lam du gsungs so //
translated: The Dharma that accomplishes that individually is said to be the good path.

original: ston par byed pa ni legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po @60b ste ;
analyzed: ston par byed pa ni legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po @60b ste ;
translated: The Teacher is the Teacher of the Good Path.

original: bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is that.

original: de ltar yang rin po che'i phreng ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang rin po che'i phreng ba las gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Precious Garland:

original: nges par legs pa'i chos kyang ni //
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i chos kyang ni //
translated: The Dharma of definite goodness

original: phra dang zab mo ston byed pa //üîΩbyis pa thos dang mi ldan rnams //
analyzed: phra dang zab mo ston byed pa // byis pa thos dang mi ldan rnams //
translated: The teaching of the subtle and profoundüîΩTerrifies the childish who are devoid of learning

original: rgyal bas gsungs la skrag par byed //
analyzed: rgyal bas gsungs la skrag par byed //
translated: And who are attached to the teaching of self.

original: ces so // don grub bsam pa grub pa ste //üîΩkun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: ces so // don grub bsam pa grub pa ste // kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: The Accomplished Object is the Accomplishment of Intention,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: Which is the abandonment of all conceptualization.

original: de la don du gnyer bas na don te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: de la don du gnyer bas na don te gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lo //
translated: Here, the object is the object of desire, such as form, etc.

original: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos 'jig rten pa la shin tu grags te /
analyzed: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos pos 'jig rten pa la shin tu grags te /
translated: Moreover, the objective world is well known to the world as the entity of the grasped and the grasper.

original: don yang de yin la grub pa yang de yin pas don grub po //üîΩ'di ni phyi'i don nyid du rnam par rtog pa goms pa rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa dang / bdag dang spyi dang / yon tan dang / bya ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: don yang de yin la grub pa yang de yin pas don grub po // 'di ni phyi'i don nyid du rnam par rtog pa goms pa rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa dang / bdag dang spyi dang / yon tan dang / bya ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: Since it is an object and it is accomplished, it is the accomplished object.üîΩThis is the imagined nature, which is the adherence to the reality of the specific and the general, of quality and action, etc.,

original: mtshan nyid rnams la de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams la de kho na nyid du mngon par zhen pa ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: in regard to form, etc., which is the habitual notion of external objects.

original: de ltar slob dpon dbyig gnyen zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon dbyig gnyen zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus the Master Vasubandhu has said:

original: rnam par rtog pa gang gang gis //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gang gang gis //
translated: Whatever conceptualizationüîΩthere is of any thing,

original: dngos po gang gang rnam brtags pa //üîΩde nyid kun du brtags pa yi //
analyzed: dngos po gang gang rnam brtags pa // de nyid kun du brtags pa yi //
translated: that is the imagined nature,

original: ngo bo nyid de de med do //üîΩzhes so // bsam pa grub pa ni bsam pa nyid pas bsam pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de de med do // zhes so // bsam pa grub pa ni bsam pa nyid pas bsam pa'o //
translated: and it does not exist.üîΩThe fulfilled is the fulfilled itself, because it is fulfilled.

original: bsam pa yang de yin la grub pa yang de nyid yin pas bsam pa grub pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa yang de yin la grub pa yang de nyid yin pas bsam pa grub pa ste /
translated: It is the fulfilled because it is the fulfilled and it is also fulfilled.

original: gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the dependent nature.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag la rag las pas na gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag la rag las pas na gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: It is dependent because it depends on causes and conditions.üîΩThus, it is the dependent nature.üîΩIn this way, it is the dependent nature, because it is dependent on causes and conditions.üîΩIn this way, it is the dependent nature.üîΩIn this way, it is the dependent nature.üîΩIn this way, it is the dependent nature.üîΩIn this way, it is the dependent nature.

original: gnyis su snang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa mi rtag pa nyid dang rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa mi rtag pa nyid dang rgyu nyid de /
translated: The other-dependent is the impermanence and causality of the mind and mental functions, which have the characteristics of conceptual thoughts that appear dualistically.

original: yul nyid du rnam par rtog pa de ni gzhan dbang ngo //
analyzed: yul nyid du rnam par rtog pa de ni gzhan dbang ngo //
translated: The conceptualization of objects is the other-dependent.

original: 'di ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: The other-dependent reality

original: rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung //üîΩzhes so // kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: rnam rtog yin te rkyen las byung // zhes so // kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: Is conceptual thought, arising from conditions.

original: zhes pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /üîΩgzhan dbang 'di rang bzhin gyis lam rnam par dag pa'am /
analyzed: zhes pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de / gzhan dbang 'di rang bzhin gyis lam rnam par dag pa'am /
translated: The line ‚ÄúAbandoning all conceptual thought‚Äù refers to the fulfilled reality.üîΩThis other-dependent reality is by nature pure, or free from all the stains of obscurations.

original: sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i stong pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i stong pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Nondual emptiness is the fulfilled reality.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: grub ni de la snga ma'o //
analyzed: grub ni de la snga ma'o //
translated: The fulfilled is the former,

original: rtag tu med par 'gyur de yin //üîΩzhes so // @61a * //
analyzed: rtag tu med par 'gyur de yin // zhes so // @61a * //
translated: Always free from nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Therefore, there are three realities.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat is the wisdom being of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad //
translated: The nonconceptual realm is inexhaustible.

original: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
analyzed: chos dbyings dam pa zad mi shes //
translated: The supreme realm of phenomena is inexhaustible.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ye shes la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa ni yongs su grub pa'i ye shes la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nonconceptual means that the thoroughly established nature is wisdom that is free from conceptuality.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam par rtog las ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog las ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from conceptuality,

original: 'khor ba zhes bya yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'khor ba zhes bya yod ma yin //
translated: There is no so-called sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de phyir rtog dang mi ldan pa //
analyzed: de phyir rtog dang mi ldan pa //
translated: Therefore, you who are free from conceptuality

original: rtag tu khyod ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: rtag tu khyod ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Are always in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: zhes so // dbyings zhes pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes so // dbyings zhes pa ni skye ba dang ldan pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi rgyu'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Realm means that it is the cause of all conditioned phenomena that arise.

original: 'dir ni dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir ni dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning of realm is the meaning of cause.

original: mi zad ces pa ni stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi zad ces pa ni stong pa nyid de /
translated: Inexhaustible means emptiness.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is equal to space.

original: chos dbyings ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams de la dmigs na skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dbyings ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams de la dmigs na skye ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The dharmadhatu is the cause of the arising of the dharmas of the aryas when it is objectified.

original: dam pa zhes pa ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa zhes pa ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest because it is superior to the heterodox, sravakas, etc.

original: zad mi shes pa ni 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa ni 'dus ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it is uncompounded.

original: bsod nams ldan pas bsod nams tshogs //üîΩye shes ye shes khyad par che //
analyzed: bsod nams ldan pas bsod nams tshogs // ye shes ye shes khyad par che //
translated: The one who possesses merit has the accumulation of merit.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: Knowledge is the great distinction of knowledge.

original: de la gso zhing gnas pas na bsod nams te /
analyzed: de la gso zhing gnas pas na bsod nams te /
translated: Here, merit is that by which one is nourished and sustained.

original: de de la yod pas bsod nams ldan pa'o //üîΩbsod nams tshogs ni yang dag par bsags pa de ni tshogs te /
analyzed: de de la yod pas bsod nams ldan pa'o // bsod nams tshogs ni yang dag par bsags pa de ni tshogs te /
translated: Since it exists in him, he is the one who possesses merit.üîΩThe accumulation of merit is the accumulation of merit.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The accumulation of merit is the accumulation of merit.

original: de'i phyir na 'dir tshig gnyis kyis 'di ltar gsung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir na 'dir tshig gnyis kyis 'di ltar gsung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, here it is said in this way by two words.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang mi ldan pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs dang mi ldan pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not that he does not possess the accumulation of merit, mundane and supramundane. This is the meaning.

original: ye shes zhes pa ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes zhes pa ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The term ‚Äúgnosis‚Äù refers to the gnosis of non-Buddhists, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and so on.

original: ye shes khyad par zhes pa ni phyi rol pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes de las gzhan pa'i ye shes ni ye shes khyad par te /
analyzed: ye shes khyad par zhes pa ni phyi rol pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i ye shes de las gzhan pa'i ye shes ni ye shes khyad par te /
translated: The term ‚Äúdistinctive gnosis‚Äù refers to the gnosis that is other than the gnosis of non-Buddhists, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and so on.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is the gnosis of the extremely pure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: ye shes der ma gtogs pa ni sems yin te /
analyzed: ye shes der ma gtogs pa ni sems yin te /
translated: That which is not included in that gnosis is mind.

original: phyi'i don ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / tshad ma dang 'gal ba yang rgyas par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i don ni tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / tshad ma dang 'gal ba yang rgyas par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because external objects are contradicted by valid cognition, and because the contradiction with valid cognition is extensively established.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dngos po thams cad mthong ba yang tshad ma thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir ye shes khyad par can @61b te ;
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras khams gsum po 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes lung las 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dngos po thams cad mthong ba yang tshad ma thams cad dang 'gal ba'i phyir ye shes khyad par can @61b te ;
translated: O son of the victors, because it is stated in the scriptures that ‚Äúthese three realms are mind only,‚Äù and because the perception of all things is contradicted by all valid cognitions, it is a distinctive gnosis.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na che ba zhes pa ste ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams gsum yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pa can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na che ba zhes pa ste ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sems can gyi khams gsum yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pa can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is ‚Äúgreat‚Äù because it has the intention to completely protect the three realms of sentient beings without exception.

original: ye shes ldan pa yod med shes //üîΩtshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
analyzed: ye shes ldan pa yod med shes // tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po //
translated: Endowed with wisdom, knowing existence and nonexistence,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: The one who has accumulated the accumulations of the two accumulations.

original: de la ye shes ldan pa ni de 'dra ba'i dngos po'i ye shes dang gang ldan pa de ni ye shes ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes ldan pa ni de 'dra ba'i dngos po'i ye shes dang gang ldan pa de ni ye shes ldan pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúendowed with wisdom‚Äù means the one who possesses the wisdom of such things.

original: yod med shes pa ni yod pa dang med pa ni yod med do //
analyzed: yod med shes pa ni yod pa dang med pa ni yod med do //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing existence and nonexistence‚Äù means existence and nonexistence are existence and nonexistence.

original: de gnyis shes pa ni yod med shas pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis shes pa ni yod med shas pa'o //
translated: Knowing those two is knowing existence and nonexistence.

original: de de la yod pas na yod med shes te /
analyzed: de de la yod pas na yod med shes te /
translated: Since that exists for him, he is one who knows existence and nonexistence.

original: de ltar slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said by the master ƒÄryadeva:

original: yod med yod med ces pa ni ;
analyzed: yod med yod med ces pa ni ;
translated: Existence and nonexistence are not

original: / phyogs gnyis la yang yod min la //
analyzed: / phyogs gnyis la yang yod min la //
translated: In either of the two positions.

original: nye bar dmigs pa ring nas kyang //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa ring nas kyang //
translated: Even from far away, the observed

original: de ni brjod par nus pa min //
analyzed: de ni brjod par nus pa min //
translated: Cannot be expressed.

original: zhes so // tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po ni gong du gsungs pa'i tshogs gnyis bsags pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po ni gong du gsungs pa'i tshogs gnyis bsags pa ste /
translated: The one who has accumulated the two collections is the one who has accumulated the two collections mentioned above.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúperfected‚Äù is the same as ‚Äúaccumulated.‚Äù

original: rtag pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can //
analyzed: rtag pa kun rgyal rnal 'byor can //
translated: The one who is constant, the universal monarch, the yogi,

original: bsam gtan bsam bya blo ldan mchog / ces pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan bsam bya blo ldan mchog / ces pa ni /
translated: The one who is meditative, the one who is wise, the supreme one.

original: de la rtag pa ni rgyun gyi rtag pa 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la rtag pa ni rgyun gyi rtag pa 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therein, ‚Äúconstant‚Äù means constant through continuity, because he remains for as long as cyclic life endures.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis mi 'da' ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis mi 'da' ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he does not pass beyond the nature of the ultimate realm.

original: kun rgyal zhes pa ni /
analyzed: kun rgyal zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúUniversal monarch‚Äù means

original: kun ni 'gro ba sna tshogs te /
analyzed: kun ni 'gro ba sna tshogs te /
translated: ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù refers to the variety of living beings.

original: rgyal ba ni snang ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyal ba ni snang ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúMonarch‚Äù means ‚Äúilluminator.‚Äù

original: kun gyi rgyal po ni kun te g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gyi rgyal po ni kun te g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: The universal monarch is the one who is the nature of all things, both moving and unmoving.

original: rnal 'byor can ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can ni /
translated: ‚ÄúYogi‚Äù means

original: ye shes tsam la snyoms zhugs pa /
analyzed: ye shes tsam la snyoms zhugs pa /
translated: ‚Äúone who is absorbed in mere intuition.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor zhes ni bshad pa yin //üîΩzhes pa'i tshig gi phyir na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes ni bshad pa yin //üîΩzhes pa'i tshig gi phyir na /
translated: This is explained as ‚Äúyogi.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Yoga is nondual intuition.

original: de de la yod pas na rnal 'byor can no //
analyzed: de de la yod pas na rnal 'byor can no //
translated: He is endowed with yoga because he possesses that.

original: bsam gtan ni bsam gtan bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni bsam gtan bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Dhyana is the nature of the four trances.

original: bsam bya ni bsam par bya ba'i yul nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam bya ni bsam par bya ba'i yul nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The object of meditation is the object to be contemplated.

original: blo ldan mchog ni blo gros so //üîΩblo rnams kyi mchog ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: blo ldan mchog ni blo gros so // blo rnams kyi mchog ni gtso bo ste /
translated: The wise one is supreme intelligence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Among the various kinds of intelligence, he is the supreme one, the chief, because he is the nature of the intuition body of all the transcendent lords.

original: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: so so rang rig mi g-yo ba /
translated: It is individually intuitive, unmoving,

original: mchog gi dang po sku gsum 'chang //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po sku gsum 'chang //
translated: The supreme first body, the bearer of the three bodies.

original: zhes pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya bas na so so rang rig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni so so rang gis rig par bya bas na so so rang rig ste /
translated: It is individually intuitive because it is to be intuited individually by each person.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis rang rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis rang rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is self intuition because it is the intuition of the reality realm.

original: dper na bu mo shin tu dga' ba'i bde ba bzhin du gzhan rnams la bstan par mi 'byor ba'i @62a * //
analyzed: dper na bu mo shin tu dga' ba'i bde ba bzhin du gzhan rnams la bstan par mi 'byor ba'i @62a * //
translated: For example, just as the bliss of a virgin cannot be communicated to others,

original: phyir ro // de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyir ro // de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: so it is said:

original: gcig min du ma ma yin bdag dang gzhan la phan pa phun tshogs chen po'i gzhir gyur pa //
analyzed: gcig min du ma ma yin bdag dang gzhan la phan pa phun tshogs chen po'i gzhir gyur pa //
translated: Not one, not many, the basis of the great perfection of benefit for self and other.

original: dngos po dang dngos med ma yin nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam rtogs dka'i rang bzhin can //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos med ma yin nam mkha' bzhin du ro mnyam rtogs dka'i rang bzhin can //
translated: Not a thing, not a non-thing, the nature of equality like space, difficult to realize.

original: gos pa med cing mi 'gyur gzhi la mi mnyam mnyam la khyab pa po ste spros med pa //
analyzed: gos pa med cing mi 'gyur gzhi la mi mnyam mnyam la khyab pa po ste spros med pa //
translated: Unattached, unchanging, equal in the unequal, all-pervading, free from conceptual elaborations.

original: so so rang rig dpe med rgyal ba rnams kyi chos sku de la bdag ni phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: so so rang rig dpe med rgyal ba rnams kyi chos sku de la bdag ni phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to that Dharma Body of the Victorious Ones, to be realized personally, without example.

original: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir na mi g-yo ba zhes pa ni gang gi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir na mi g-yo ba zhes pa ni gang gi phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: For this very reason, immovable has the meaning of because.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal de nyid mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal de nyid mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: For this very reason, the Blessed One, Manjusri, is immovable.

original: rtog pa kun gyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩmchog gi dang po ni dang po'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyi yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro // mchog gi dang po ni dang po'i dngos po ste /
translated: Because he is not an object of conceptualization.üîΩThe supreme first is the state of the first.

original: mchog kyang de yin la dang po yang yin pas mchog gi dang po'o //
analyzed: mchog kyang de yin la dang po yang yin pas mchog gi dang po'o //
translated: It is supreme and it is first, thus it is the supreme first.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: He is the Blessed One, glorious Vajrasattva.

original: sku gsum 'chang ni sku gsum ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku gsum rnams so //
analyzed: sku gsum 'chang ni sku gsum ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sku gsum rnams so //
translated: The bearer of the three bodies is the bearer of the three bodies, which are the three bodies characterized as the Dharma body, the enjoyment body, and the emanation body.

original: de dag 'dzin pas na sku gsum 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de dag 'dzin pas na sku gsum 'chang ngo //
translated: He is the bearer of the three bodies because he holds them.

original: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku lnga'i bdag nyid can //
translated: He is the embodiment of the five buddha bodies.

original: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod phan can //üîΩspyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
analyzed: khyab bdag ye shes lnga yi bdag / sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod phan can // spyan lnga chags pa med pa 'chang //
translated: He is the lord of the five gnoses, the lord of the five buddhas,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: and the bearer of the five eyes without attachment.

original: de la sangs rgyas ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas ni bshad zin to //
translated: Here, the Buddha has already been explained.

original: sku lnga'i bdag nyid ces pa ni ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / sprul pa dang / chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid rnams te sku lnga'o //
analyzed: sku lnga'i bdag nyid ces pa ni ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / sprul pa dang / chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid rnams te sku lnga'o //
translated: The embodiment of the five bodies is the five bodies, which are the essence body, the enjoyment body, the maturation body, the emanation body, and the Dharma body.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang dang ldan pa de ni sku lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang dang ldan pa de ni sku lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: He who possesses the nature of those is the embodiment of the five bodies.

original: khyab bdag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: khyab bdag ni bshad zin to //
translated: The lord has already been explained.

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun du rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de dag ni ye shes lnga'o //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor kun du rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes de dag ni ye shes lnga'o //
translated: The nature of the five gnoses is the mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of equality, the gnosis of individual realization, the gnosis of successful activities, and the gnosis of the extremely pure sphere of reality.

original: de rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang gang ldan pa de ni ye shes lnga'i bdag go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dang gang ldan pa de ni ye shes lnga'i bdag go //
translated: He who possesses the nature of those is the nature of the five gnoses.

original: sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can ni mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub ba dang / rnam par snang mdzad rnams ni sangs rgyas lnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can ni mi bskyod pa dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub ba dang / rnam par snang mdzad rnams ni sangs rgyas lnga'o //
translated: The nature of the five buddhas is Akshobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitabha, Amoghasiddhi, and Vairochana.

original: de nyid kyi bdag nyid dang de'i rang bzhin gyis dbu rgyan dang gang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas lnga bdag dbu rgyan can no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi bdag nyid dang de'i rang bzhin gyis dbu rgyan dang gang ldan pa de ni sangs rgyas lnga bdag dbu rgyan can no //
translated: He who possesses the nature of those and their essence is the nature of the five buddhas.

original: spyan lnga ni sha dang / lha @62b dang ; shes rab dang / chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan rnams gang la mnga' ba de ni spyan lnga'o //
analyzed: spyan lnga ni sha dang / lha @62b dang ; shes rab dang / chos dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan rnams gang la mnga' ba de ni spyan lnga'o //
translated: The five eyes are the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, the eye of Dharma, and the eye of a buddha.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na chags pa med pa 'chang ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na chags pa med pa 'chang ste /
translated: He is the one who holds the unattached,

original: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med la 'khrul pa med par gzigs pa gang yin pa de ni chags pa med pa gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la chags pa med pa dang / thogs pa med la 'khrul pa med par gzigs pa gang yin pa de ni chags pa med pa gzigs pa'o //
translated: because he sees all objects of knowledge without attachment, without obstruction, and without error.

original: de ltar chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the Abhidharma:

original: dgra bcom bse ru ston rnams kyis //
analyzed: dgra bcom bse ru ston rnams kyis //
translated: The arhats, rhinoceroses, and teachers

original: stong gnyis gnyis dang grangs med mthong //
analyzed: stong gnyis gnyis dang grangs med mthong //
translated: see two thousand, two thousand, and innumerable.

original: zhes so // sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
analyzed: zhes so // sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po //
translated: The one who generates all buddhas

original: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras po dam pa'i mchog / ces pa ni /
translated: is the supreme son of the buddhas.

original: de la sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po ni 'byung ba po ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas thams cad skyed pa po ni 'byung ba po ste /
translated: Here, the one who generates all buddhas is the producer,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the nature of the thought of enlightenment of all buddhas.

original: de ltar yang de nyid 'dus pa las gsungs pa /üîΩbyung dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: de ltar yang de nyid 'dus pa las gsungs pa / byung dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yi //
translated: Thus the Compendium of Principles says:üîΩThe Tathagatas of the past and future

original: de bzhin gshegs rnams khyod la brten //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs rnams khyod la brten //
translated: are based on you.

original: zhes so // sangs rgyas sras po ni sgrib pa'i bag chags thams cad las rnam par grol ba rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mkhyen pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i dngos po rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par ni sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: zhes so // sangs rgyas sras po ni sgrib pa'i bag chags thams cad las rnam par grol ba rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mkhyen pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa'i dngos po rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par ni sangs rgyas te /
translated: The Buddha-son is the Buddha because he is the one who is liberated from all the instinctual natures of the obscurations, who knows all things in all their aspects, and who is the basis for all sentient beings, and his special non-conceptual intuition.

original: de'i sras po ni sangs rgyas sras po ste /
analyzed: de'i sras po ni sangs rgyas sras po ste /
translated: The son of the Buddha is the Buddha-son.

original: sras ni bdag las skyes pas so //
analyzed: sras ni bdag las skyes pas so //
translated: The son is born from the self.

original: de'ang bdag nyid ni don dam par de bzhin nyid las rab tu byung ba'am /
analyzed: de'ang bdag nyid ni don dam par de bzhin nyid las rab tu byung ba'am /
translated: Moreover, the self is the Buddha because it has come forth from the suchness of the ultimate,

original: rtog pa med pa'i ye shes so sor rtog pa las byung bas na sangs rgyas su bshad de /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i ye shes so sor rtog pa las byung bas na sangs rgyas su bshad de /
translated: or because it has come forth from the discrimination of non-conceptual intuition.

original: don des byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas sras zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don des byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas sras zhes gsungs so //
translated: For this reason, the Bodhisattva is said to be the son of the Buddha.

original: dam pa ni rab nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ni rab nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The supreme is the best.

original: mchog ni mngon par 'gro bar bya ba rnams kyi nang na ma nor ba mchog nyid do //
analyzed: mchog ni mngon par 'gro bar bya ba rnams kyi nang na ma nor ba mchog nyid do //
translated: Supreme is the best of all that are to be transcended.

original: shes rab srid 'byung skye gnas nyid //üîΩchos kyi 'byung gnas srid pa sel //
analyzed: shes rab srid 'byung skye gnas nyid // chos kyi 'byung gnas srid pa sel //
translated: Wisdom is the source of existence, the origin of birth.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: The source of Dharma, the dispeller of existence.

original: de la shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is the thorough analysis of phenomena.

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang gang zag gnyis kyis rnam par dben pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang gang zag gnyis kyis rnam par dben pa'o //
translated: It is also the isolation of both the supramundane Dharma and the person.

original: shes rab srid pa ni dag pa'i phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: shes rab srid pa ni dag pa'i phung po lnga ste /
translated: The source of existence is the five pure aggregates.

original: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba rnams so //
translated: They are morality, meditative stabilization, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of the wisdom of liberation.

original: de rnams las 'byung ba ni shes rab srid 'byung zhes bcom ldan 'das la gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams las 'byung ba ni shes rab srid 'byung zhes bcom ldan 'das la gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One said that the origin of those is the source of existence.

original: skye gnas ni byed rgyu @63a * //
analyzed: skye gnas ni byed rgyu @63a * //
translated: The origin is the active cause.

original: ste ; skye ba dang ldan zhing bsgrub bya dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skyed byed de /
analyzed: ste ; skye ba dang ldan zhing bsgrub bya dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi skyed byed de /
translated: It is the producer of phenomena that possess production and that possess something to be accomplished.

original: chos rnams 'byung ba zhes pa la /
analyzed: chos rnams 'byung ba zhes pa la /
translated: The source of phenomena is the source of phenomena.

original: chos rnams kyi skye gnas ni chos kyi 'byung gnas te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi skye gnas ni chos kyi 'byung gnas te /
translated: The source of phenomena is the source of phenomena.

original: chos ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams so //
analyzed: chos ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams so //
translated: Phenomena are the uncontaminated virtuous paths of action.

original: de rnams kyi 'byung ba'i gnas ni rgyu zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'byung ba'i gnas ni rgyu zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The source of those is the meaning of cause.

original: srid pa sel ni srid pa ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa sel ni srid pa ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: The end of existence is the end of existence.

original: de mthar byed pa ni srid mthar byed do //
analyzed: de mthar byed pa ni srid mthar byed do //
translated: The end of that is the end of existence.üîΩThe self of the single hard vajra,

original: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / skyes ma thag tu 'gro ba'i bdag / ces pa ni /
analyzed: gcig pu sra mkhregs rdo rje'i bdag / skyes ma thag tu 'gro ba'i bdag / ces pa ni /
translated: the self of the world as soon as it arises.

original: de la gcig pu sra mkhregs ni gcig pu sra ba yang de yin la mkhregs pa yang de yin pas gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
analyzed: de la gcig pu sra mkhregs ni gcig pu sra ba yang de yin la mkhregs pa yang de yin pas gcig pu sra mkhregs so //
translated: Regarding that, the single hard is the single hard, therefore it is the single hard.

original: sra ba ni brtan pa ste bar chad med pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sra ba ni brtan pa ste bar chad med pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Hard means stable, because it is uninterrupted.

original: mkhregs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhregs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Hard means free from the stains of afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na rdo rje'i bdag ces pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na rdo rje'i bdag ces pa ste /
translated: For that very reason, it is the self of the vajra,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ye shes mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the indivisible vajra-like wisdom.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang dang ldan pa de rdo rje'i bdag ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang dang ldan pa de rdo rje'i bdag ste /
translated: The one who has the nature of that is the vajra self,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the gnosis body of all the tathagatas.

original: skyes ma thag ni gang dang gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba de dang der skad cig nyid la skye ba yongs su bzhes pa'i phyir na skyes ma thag ces gsungs te /
analyzed: skyes ma thag ni gang dang gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba de dang der skad cig nyid la skye ba yongs su bzhes pa'i phyir na skyes ma thag ces gsungs te /
translated: As soon as he is born, wherever he sees the welfare of sentient beings, he takes birth in an instant, and so he is called the one who is born.

original: skye ba la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he has attained power over birth.

original: 'gro ba'i bdag ni 'gro ba rnams kyi bdag po ni 'gro ba'i bdag ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bdag ni 'gro ba rnams kyi bdag po ni 'gro ba'i bdag ste /
translated: The lord of beings is the lord of beings, the master of beings,

original: 'gro ba'i rje bo zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rje bo zhes pa'i don te /
translated: meaning the lord of beings.

original: de rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because he is the basis of all their perfections,

original: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung rang byung ba //
translated: he is the one who arises from space, the self arisen one.

original: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
analyzed: shes rab ye shes me bo che //
translated: The great fire of the gnosis of wisdom

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This has three parts:

original: de la nam mkha' las byung ba ni nam mkha' ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' las byung ba ni nam mkha' ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: As for arising from space, space is the wisdom of emptiness.

original: de las byung bas nam mkha' las byung ba'o //üîΩrang byung ni rang byung bas na rang byung ste /
analyzed: de las byung bas nam mkha' las byung ba'o // rang byung ni rang byung bas na rang byung ste /
translated: Since it arises from that, it is ‚Äúarisen from space.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems rdo rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshes rab ye shes me bo che //
analyzed: byang chub sems rdo rje'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // shes rab ye shes me bo che //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-arisen‚Äù means self-arisen because it is the nature of the vajra mind of enlightenment.üîΩThe great fire of the gnosis of wisdom

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: is the great fire of the gnosis of wisdom.

original: shes rab ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni shes rab ye shes te ;
analyzed: shes rab ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid ni shes rab ye shes te ;
translated: Wisdom is the characteristic of nondual gnosis, the gnosis of wisdom.

original: rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: It is gnosis that is the nature of nonconceptuality.

original: de nyid me ste bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bud shing sreg par nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid me ste bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bud shing sreg par nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is fire because it is capable of burning the kindling of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: che zhes pa ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / nam mkha' dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba zhes pa brgyad kyi spyi @63b gzugs nyid pas chen po'o //
analyzed: che zhes pa ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / nam mkha' dang / nyi ma dang / zla ba zhes pa brgyad kyi spyi @63b gzugs nyid pas chen po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat‚Äù is great because it is the universal form of the eight‚Äîearth, water, fire, wind, action, space, sun, and moon.

original: yang na ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / stobs dang / gzi brjid dang / nus pa dang / dbang phyug rnams te /
analyzed: yang na ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / stobs dang / gzi brjid dang / nus pa dang / dbang phyug rnams te /
translated: Alternatively, it is gnosis, diligence, power, splendor, ability, and lordship.

original: yon tan drug dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: yon tan drug dang ldan pas so //
translated: Because it possesses six qualities.

original: 'od chen rnam par snang bar byed //
analyzed: 'od chen rnam par snang bar byed //
translated: Great light, illuminating,

original: ye shes skar ma lam me ba //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: ye shes skar ma lam me ba // zhes pa ni /
translated: The shining star of wisdom,

original: de la 'od chen ni cher gsal bar byed pas na 'od chen te /
analyzed: de la 'od chen ni cher gsal bar byed pas na 'od chen te /
translated: Here, great light is the great illumination,

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi sgo nas te /
translated: Through the door of extremely pure wisdom.

original: 'od ni shes bya gsal bar byed pas chos mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'od ni shes bya gsal bar byed pas chos mthun pa'o //
translated: The light is similar to the object of knowledge, because it illuminates.

original: rnam par snang bar byed pa'i don ni bshad zin to //üîΩye shes skar ma ni gzung 'dzin med pa'i phyir na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de'i skar ma ni ye shes skar ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang bar byed pa'i don ni bshad zin to // ye shes skar ma ni gzung 'dzin med pa'i phyir na gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de'i skar ma ni ye shes skar ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The meaning of illuminating has already been explained.üîΩThe shining star of wisdom is the star of that nondual wisdom, because it is free from subject and object.

original: me long lta bu'i ya shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ya shes kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is called the shining star of wisdom, because it is the nature of mirror-like wisdom.

original: lam me ba ni gsal zhing lam me ba ste /
analyzed: lam me ba ni gsal zhing lam me ba ste /
translated: Shining is clear and shining,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'gro ba kun gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus 'gro ba kun gyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the enjoyment body benefits all beings.

original: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mar me ye shes sgron //
translated: The lamp of beings, the torch of wisdom,

original: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po 'od gsal ba //
translated: The great splendor, the clear light,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: Here,

original: de la 'gro ba'i mar me ni 'gro ba rnams kyi mar me dang 'dra bas 'gro ba'i mar me ste /
analyzed: de la 'gro ba'i mar me ni 'gro ba rnams kyi mar me dang 'dra bas 'gro ba'i mar me ste /
translated: The lamp of beings is like the lamp of beings, so it is the lamp of beings.

original: so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor kun du rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the essence of the individually discriminating pristine consciousness.

original: ye shes sgron me zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sgron me'i 'od dang ldan pa de ni ye shes sgron te /
analyzed: ye shes sgron me zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sgron me'i 'od dang ldan pa de ni ye shes sgron te /
translated: The lamp of pristine consciousness is the light of the lamp of pristine consciousness. It is the lamp of pristine consciousness.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the pristine consciousness of uniformity.üîΩGreat splendor is the one who possesses the light of great splendor.

original: gzi brjid chen po ni gzi brjid chen po'i 'od dang gang ldan pa de gzi brjid chen po ste /
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po ni gzi brjid chen po'i 'od dang gang ldan pa de gzi brjid chen po ste /
translated: It is great splendor.

original: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyi sgo nas so //
translated: It is through the door of the pristine consciousness of activities.

original: 'od gsal ba ni phul du byung bas rab tu gsal ba ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni phul du byung bas rab tu gsal ba ste /
translated: Illumination is the most excellent, clear light.

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses.

original: kun nas snang ba'i tshul dang ldan pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yin no //
analyzed: kun nas snang ba'i tshul dang ldan pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yin no //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ possesses the method of universal illumination.

original: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
analyzed: sngags mchog mnga' bdag rig sngags rgyal //
translated: The lord of the supreme mantra, the king of awareness mantras,

original: gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po don chen byed //
translated: the king of secret mantras, the one who performs great benefits,

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /
translated: is the one who is explained.

original: de la sngags mchog mnga' bdag ni sngags kyang de yin la mchog kyang de yin pas na sngags mchog ste /
analyzed: de la sngags mchog mnga' bdag ni sngags kyang de yin la mchog kyang de yin pas na sngags mchog ste /
translated: The lord of the supreme mantra is the supreme mantra itself.üîΩ

original: de'i bdag ni gtso bo ste /üîΩ'dir sngags mchog mnga' bdag ni yi ge h'um las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag ni gtso bo ste / 'dir sngags mchog mnga' bdag ni yi ge h'um las shes par bya'o //
translated: The lord of the supreme mantra is the supreme mantra, and he is the lord of that.

original: de'i phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyag rgya chen po'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The great seal of that is the great seal.

original: rig sngags rgyal ni rig sngags rnams kyi rgyal po ni rig rgyal te /
analyzed: rig sngags rgyal ni rig sngags rnams kyi rgyal po ni rig rgyal te /
translated: The knowledge king is the king of knowledge mantras.

original: thams cad du rig sngags te gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du gyur pa rnams kyis skyed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsang sngags rgyal po ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i gsang @64a * //
analyzed: thams cad du rig sngags te gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor du gyur pa rnams kyis skyed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro // gsang sngags rgyal po ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i gsang @64a * //
translated: The knowledge mantras are the mantras of the retention mandala, and he is the producer of all of them.

original: sngags rnams kyi rgyal po ni gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi rgyal po ni gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
translated: The mantra king is the king of the mantras taught in the Dharma mandala.

original: don chen byed ni don yang de yin la chen po yang de yin pas don chen no //
analyzed: don chen byed ni don yang de yin la chen po yang de yin pas don chen no //
translated: The great meaning is the great meaning.

original: de byed pas na don chen byed de las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchod pa ma lus pa phyi dang gsang ba dang sems las byung ba gsum gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod par byed pa nyid kyis
analyzed: de byed pas na don chen byed de las kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchod pa ma lus pa phyi dang gsang ba dang sems las byung ba gsum gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod par byed pa nyid kyis
translated: Since one does that, one performs the great purpose, since one makes offerings to all the tathagatas with the three offerings of body, speech, and mind, which are the outer, inner, and innermost offerings, as taught in the mandala of activities.

original: gzhal du med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar sogs par byed pas na sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs nye bar sogs par byed pas na sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one accumulates the immeasurable collection of merit, one performs the purpose of all sentient beings.üîΩThe great u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, the crest of wonders,

original: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug / nam mkha'i bdag po sna tshogs ston //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: gtsug tor chen po rmad byung gtsug / nam mkha'i bdag po sna tshogs ston // zhes pa ni /
translated: the lord of space, displaying variety.

original: de la gtsug tor chen po ni gtsug tor yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas na gtsug tor chen po ste /
analyzed: de la gtsug tor chen po ni gtsug tor yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas na gtsug tor chen po ste /
translated: With regard to that, since it is the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a and it is great, it is the great u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor gyi rnam pas phung por gyur cing 'phungs  par gyur par rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor gyi rnam pas phung por gyur cing 'phungs  par gyur par rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is the collection and the heap of the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£as of all tathƒÅgatas, it is the great u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyi gtsug yin pas de'i phyir yang gtsug tor chen po zhes gsungs so //üîΩrmad byung gtsug ni gzi brjid spungs pa'i sgo nas gang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang ye shes sems dpa' gang yin pa 'di gzi brjid kyi phung po'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor las spros pa'i rdo rje'i tshul
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyi gtsug yin pas de'i phyir yang gtsug tor chen po zhes gsungs so // rmad byung gtsug ni gzi brjid spungs pa'i sgo nas gang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang ye shes sems dpa' gang yin pa 'di gzi brjid kyi phung po'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor las spros pa'i rdo rje'i tshul
translated: Since he is the crown of all the Tathagatas, he is also called the Great U·π£·πáƒ´·π£a.üîΩThe wondrous crown is the mass of splendor, which is the splendor of the Blessed One, the wisdom being of all the TathƒÅgatas.

original: du spyi bor gnas pa gang yin pa de ni rmad byung gtsug ces gsungs so //üîΩnam mkha' bdag po ni nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: du spyi bor gnas pa gang yin pa de ni rmad byung gtsug ces gsungs so // nam mkha' bdag po ni nam mkha' ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: The one who abides on the crown in the manner of a vajra emanated from the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a of all the TathƒÅgatas through the mass of splendor is called the wondrous crown.üîΩThe lord of space is space, and space is the lord of that space.

original: nam mkha' de'i bdag po ste stong pa nyid kyi bdag po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' de'i bdag po ste stong pa nyid kyi bdag po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that emptiness is the lord.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: dmigs pa dang ni bral ba'i sems //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ni bral ba'i sems //
translated: The mind free from objectification

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid la gnas te //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid la gnas te //
translated: Rests in the characteristic of space.

original: nam mkha' sgom par byed pa 'di //
analyzed: nam mkha' sgom par byed pa 'di //
translated: This meditation on space

original: stong pa nyid ni bsgom par 'dod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni bsgom par 'dod //
translated: He is the teacher of the various,

original: ces so // sna tshogs ston ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin sna tshogs te /
analyzed: ces so // sna tshogs ston ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin sna tshogs te /
translated: The various natures of the samadhis of all the mundane and supramundane are the various.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo ston par byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de sna tshogs ston zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang rnam par thar pa'i sgo ston par byed pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de sna tshogs ston zhes pa'o //
translated: He who has the method of teaching the various samadhis and the doors of liberation is the teacher of the various.

original: sangs rgyas kun bdag ngo bo mchog /'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun bdag ngo bo mchog /'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan // zhes pa ni /
translated: He is the supreme nature, the self of all the Buddhas, and he is endowed with the eye which delights all beings.

original: de la sangs rgyas kun bdag ngo bo mchog ni sangs rgyas kyang de yin la kun kyang de yin pas sangs rgyas @64b kun te /üîΩrtag pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi bdag nyid ni sangs rgyas kun bdag go //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kun bdag ngo bo mchog ni sangs rgyas kyang de yin la kun kyang de yin pas sangs rgyas @64b kun te / rtag pa la sogs pa de rnams kyi bdag nyid ni sangs rgyas kun bdag go //
translated: The supreme nature, the self of all the Buddhas, is the supreme nature of the self of all the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kun bdag de'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun bdag de'i ngo bo ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The self of all the Buddhas is the nature of the supreme.üîΩThe supreme nature of the self of all the Buddhas is the nature of the supreme.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yod pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo yod pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: The existence of the nature of the self of all the Buddhas is the Dharmadhatu.

original: mchog gi dngos po ni mchog nyid do //
analyzed: mchog gi dngos po ni mchog nyid do //
translated: The supreme entity is the supreme one.

original: sangs rgyas kun bdag ngo bos de'i de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun bdag ngo bos de'i de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal te /
translated: The Bhagavat Manjusri is the nature of the Tathagata of all the Buddhas, because he is of one taste with suchness.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavat is the body of knowledge of all the Tathagatas.

original: 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan //
analyzed: 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan //
translated: He has the eye which delights all beings.

original: zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad dga' ba ni 'gro ba dga' ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad dga' ba ni 'gro ba dga' ba ste /
translated: The eye which delights all beings is the eye of all beings.

original: de'i mig dang ldan pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal te /
analyzed: de'i mig dang ldan pa ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal te /
translated: He has that eye, the Bhagavat Manjusri.

original: gang gis blang ba dang / spong ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i snang bas na shes rab kyi spyan no //
analyzed: gang gis blang ba dang / spong ba rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i snang bas na shes rab kyi spyan no //
translated: The eye of wisdom is the eye of wisdom, because it is the light which distinguishes what is to be accepted and what is to be rejected.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las byung //üîΩmchod 'os brjod 'os drang srong che //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las byung // mchod 'os brjod 'os drang srong che //
translated: He has a mind-made body, with various forms.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: He is worthy of offerings, worthy of praise, the great Rishi.

original: de la sna tshogs gzugs can ni g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na gzugs sna tshogs pa ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sna tshogs gzugs can ni g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyis na gzugs sna tshogs pa ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It has various forms, because it displays various forms by the very nature of all things, moving and unmoving.

original: skyed pa po ni sems can thams cad ji ltar skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzugs nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang dam tshig dang dkyil 'khor thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pa po ni sems can thams cad ji ltar skal ba dang ldan pa'i gzugs nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang dam tshig dang dkyil 'khor thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the creator, because it creates all the mantras, seals, commitments, and mandalas, in whatever forms are suitable for all sentient beings.

original: drang srong che ni drang srong yang de yin la che ba yang de nyid yin pas drang srong che ste /
analyzed: drang srong che ni drang srong yang de yin la che ba yang de nyid yin pas drang srong che ste /
translated: It is the great sage, because it is the sage and it is great.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni drang srong che zhes so //üîΩmchod 'os zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa kun gyis mchod par 'os pa nyid kyis mchod 'os te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni drang srong che zhes so // mchod 'os zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa kun gyis mchod par 'os pa nyid kyis mchod 'os te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddha is the great sage.

original: mchod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya ba'o //
translated: It is worthy of worship, because it is worthy of worship by all the mundane and supramundane, it is to be worshipped.

original: de nyid kyi phyir brjod 'os te sems can thams cad kyis bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir brjod 'os te sems can thams cad kyis bstod pa'o //
translated: It is worthy of praise, because it is praised by all sentient beings.

original: rigs gsum 'chang ba gsang sngags 'chang //üîΩdam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin //
analyzed: rigs gsum 'chang ba gsang sngags 'chang // dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin //
translated: The bearer of the three families, the bearer of the secret spells,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: the great vow, the bearer of the secret spells.

original: de la rigs gsum 'chang ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas de 'dzin pa ni rigs gsum 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de la rigs gsum 'chang ba ni sku gsung thugs kyi dbye bas de 'dzin pa ni rigs gsum 'chang ba'o //
translated: The bearer of the three families is the bearer of the body, speech, and mind families.

original: gsang sngags 'chang ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags te /
analyzed: gsang sngags 'chang ba ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags te /

original: de rnams dang gang ldan pa de ni gsang sngags can te /
analyzed: de rnams dang gang ldan pa de ni gsang sngags can te /
translated: The one who has those is the bearer of the secret spells.

original: de nyid bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de nyid bcom ldan 'das ye shes sems dpa' ste /
translated: That is the Bhagavat, the wisdom being,

original: gsang sngags kyi sku thams cad 'chang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi sku thams cad 'chang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the bearer of all the bodies of the secret spells.

original: dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin ni dam tshig kyang de yin la chen po yang de yin pas dam tshig chen po ste /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin ni dam tshig kyang de yin la chen po yang de yin pas dam tshig chen po ste /
translated: The great vow, the bearer of the secret spells, is the great vow because it is a vow and it is great.

original: de ni bcom ldan @65a * //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan @65a * //
translated: That is the Bhagavat,

original: 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the essence of the mind of enlightenment vajra.

original: de'i sngags ni shes shing skyob bas gsang sngags te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni shes shing skyob bas gsang sngags te /
translated: The secret spells are the knowledge and protection of that.

original: ye shes dang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes dang snying rje'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the embodiment of pristine wisdom and compassion.

original: de 'dzin pas na dam tshig tshin  po gsang sngags 'dzin ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na dam tshig tshin  po gsang sngags 'dzin ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: The one who holds the pledge, the mantra holder, is the Bhagavat, the pristine wisdom body of all the Tathagatas.

original: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa //
analyzed: gtso bo dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa //
translated: The one who holds the three jewels, the chief

original: theg pa mchog gsum ston pa po //
analyzed: theg pa mchog gsum ston pa po //
translated: The one who teaches the three of the supreme vehicle

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de la gtso bo ni mngon par 'gro ba thams cad kyi nang na gang dang por shin tu mngon par 'gro bar 'os pa ni de gtso bor gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gtso bo ni mngon par 'gro ba thams cad kyi nang na gang dang por shin tu mngon par 'gro bar 'os pa ni de gtso bor gsungs te /

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //

original: dkon mchog gsum ni dkon mchog rnams ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni dkon mchog rnams ni gsum ste /

original: thob dka' ba'i phyir dang / rin thang che ba'i phyir dang / rab tu gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thob dka' ba'i phyir dang / rin thang che ba'i phyir dang / rab tu gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are difficult to obtain, they are of great value, and they are very illuminating.

original: rin po che dang 'dra bas dkon mchog go //
analyzed: rin po che dang 'dra bas dkon mchog go //

original: gsum ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rnams so //
analyzed: gsum ni sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rnams so //

analyzed: de rnams 'dzin pas na dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //

original: theg pa mchog gsum ston pa po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po gsum rab tu ston pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa mchog gsum ston pa po ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / theg pa chen po gsum rab tu ston pa ste /
translated: The teacher of the three supreme vehicles is the one who teaches the three vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the Great Vehicle.

original: sems can gyi rigs thams cad la dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba mkhyen pa'i sgo nas ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs thams cad la dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba mkhyen pa'i sgo nas ston pa'i phyir ro //

original: don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal //üîΩ'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags //
analyzed: don yod zhags pa rnam par rgyal // 'dzin pa chen po rdo rje zhags //

original: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu zhags pa che //

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is said.

analyzed: de la don yod zhags pa ni don yod pa ni 'bras bu yod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the unfailing noose is the one with an unfailing result.

original: zhags pa dang 'dra bas na zhags pa ste //
analyzed: zhags pa dang 'dra bas na zhags pa ste //

original: de gang dang ldan pa de ni don yod zhags pa ste /
analyzed: de gang dang ldan pa de ni don yod zhags pa ste /
translated: The one who possesses that is the unfailing noose.

original: byang chub kyi sems rdo rjes 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin du so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rdo rjes 'dul ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin du so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba ni 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas so //
translated: The victorious is from the perspective of the samadhi of victory over the three worlds.

original: 'dzin pa chen po zhes pa ni 'dzin par byed pas na 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa chen po zhes pa ni 'dzin par byed pas na 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The great hook is a hook because it hooks.

original: 'dzin pa yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas 'dzin pa chen po ni rdo rje lcags sgrog go //
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas 'dzin pa chen po ni rdo rje lcags sgrog go //
translated: It is a hook and it is great, thus it is the great hook, which is Vajra-Amogha.

original: de yang snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: de yang snang ba mtha' yas kyi rang bzhin gyi sgo nas so //
translated: It is also from the perspective of the nature of Amitabha.

original: rdo rje zhags pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: rdo rje zhags pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sgo nas so //
