analyzed: rnam pa gang zhig gis kyang yod pa ma yin pas na dngos po med pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it does not exist in any way, it is the emptiness of non-things.

original: de'i dngos po med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid de /üîΩji ltar brtags pa bzhin du de ltar med de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ni gzhan dbang gi mtshan nyid de /üîΩji ltar brtags pa bzhin du de ltar med de /
translated: The emptiness of the non-entityness of things is the relative characteristic.üîΩSince it does not exist as it is imagined, it is the emptiness of the non-entityness of things.üîΩThe emptiness of essential nature is the perfect characteristic.

original: de thams cad du yang med pa ma yin pas na de'i dngos po ma yin pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de thams cad du yang med pa ma yin pas na de'i dngos po ma yin pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is not that it does not exist at all, it is the emptiness of what is not nonexistent.

original: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic nature is the characteristic of the perfected.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas na de'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is the intrinsic nature of emptiness, it is the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir na stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum smra ba'i tshul gang dang ldan pa de stong pa nyid smra ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na stong pa nyid rnam pa gsum smra ba'i tshul gang dang ldan pa de stong pa nyid smra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, one who possesses the method of teaching the three kinds of emptiness is a teacher of emptiness.

original: khyu mchog ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: khyu mchog ni gtso bo zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The best is the meaning of chief.

original: thams cad kyis gces par 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyis gces par 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is cherished by all.

original: stong pa nyid smra ba'ang de yin la khyu mchog kyang de nyid yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba'ang de yin la khyu mchog kyang de nyid yin pas stong pa nyid smra ba'i khyu mchog go //
translated: One who is both a teacher of emptiness and the best is the best teacher of emptiness.

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i sgra sgrogs pa ni zab cing ni gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i sgra sgrogs pa ni zab cing ni gzung 'dzin la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The proclamation of the sound of the profound and the vast is the nature of wisdom, free from the conceptualization of the apprehended and the apprehender, and so on.

original: rgya che ba ni sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'od kun du spro ba ste /
analyzed: rgya che ba ni sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bas 'od kun du spro ba ste /
translated: Vast means the emission of light in all directions, following the various emanations.

original: kun du bzang po'i ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas kyi skus sems can gyi don gyi bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas kyi skus sems can gyi don gyi bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: The nature of Samantabhadra is the buddha body that performs the deeds to benefit sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir rgya che ba'i thabs kyang rang gi sems su mtshan nyid gcig mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgya che ba'i thabs kyang rang gi sems su mtshan nyid gcig mod kyi /
translated: Because the vast method is of the same character as one's mind,

original: ldog pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: it is posited as different by the specific reversal.

original: de'i phyir na thab cing rgya che ba gnyis kyi sgra sgrogs pas mu stegs pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi lta ba zil gyis gnon par byed pa dang gang ldan pa de ni de ltar gsungs so //üîΩchos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
analyzed: de'i phyir na thab cing rgya che ba gnyis kyi sgra sgrogs pas mu stegs pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi lta ba zil gyis gnon par byed pa dang gang ldan pa de ni de ltar gsungs so // chos kyi dung ste sgra chen ldan //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one who possesses the roar of both the vast and the extensive overwhelms the views of all tƒ´rthikas and so on.üîΩThe Dharma conch, possessing a great sound,

original: chos kyi ga nd'i sgra bo che //
analyzed: chos kyi ga nd'i sgra bo che //
translated: the great sound of the Dharma conch,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: is as follows.

original: de ltar chos kyi dung ni gang gi tshe lha'i @71a * //
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi dung ni gang gi tshe lha'i @71a * //
translated: When the Dharma conch is blown,

original: rigs dga' ldan nas 'dzam bu'i gling du 'bab par 'dod pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa' chos kyi dung bus nas babs pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs dga' ldan nas 'dzam bu'i gling du 'bab par 'dod pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes sems dpa' chos kyi dung bus nas babs pa yin no //
translated: When the one who is to be born in Jambudvipa desires to descend from the Tushita heaven, the Blessed One, the Knowledge Being of all Tathagatas, having blown the Dharma conch, descends.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'di ni chos kyi dung zhes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das 'di ni chos kyi dung zhes so //
translated: Therefore, this Blessed One is called the Dharma Conch.

original: gzhan yang khyad par ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the kind of distinction?

original: gsungs pa / sgra chen ldan zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / sgra chen ldan zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said: Endowed with a great sound.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun dang thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kun dang thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is heard in all the worlds of the great trichiliocosm.

original: chos kyi gand'i ni bdud bzhi las mchog tu rgyal bar byas nas zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes mngon du byas te /
analyzed: chos kyi gand'i ni bdud bzhi las mchog tu rgyal bar byas nas zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes mngon du byas te /
translated: Having triumphed over the four maras, having realized the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising,

original: chos nyid de yang shes dka' bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos nyid de yang shes dka' bar rig nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: and knowing that reality is difficult to know, the Blessed One said:

original: rig par dka' ba bdag gis chos rigs pa'i sems can thams cad la mi bstan te /
analyzed: rig par dka' ba bdag gis chos rigs pa'i sems can thams cad la mi bstan te /
translated: I will not teach this Dharma, which is difficult to know, to all beings who are inclined to speculation.

original: rig par dka' ba de nyid kyi phyir na thugs khral chung bar gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: rig par dka' ba de nyid kyi phyir na thugs khral chung bar gnas par gyur to //
translated: For that very reason, it is difficult to know, and so he abides with little concern.

original: de'i tshe tshangs pa chen po 'ongs nas bskul bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams dbang po rno ba dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar bsags pa mgo smos pas go ba dang dad pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang yod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshangs pa chen po 'ongs nas bskul bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams dbang po rno ba dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar bsags pa mgo smos pas go ba dang dad pa dang ldan pa rnams kyang yod do //
translated: At that time, MahƒÅbrahmƒÅ came and urged him: Blessed One, there are sentient beings with sharp faculties, who have accumulated roots of virtue, who understand through brief statements, who have faith and are endowed with it.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad du gsol //
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, please explain.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lor nye bar zhugs nas chos bsgrags pa'i don du gand'i sgra bsgrags par gyur ba de'i phyir gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lor nye bar zhugs nas chos bsgrags pa'i don du gand'i sgra bsgrags par gyur ba de'i phyir gsungs pa ;
translated: At that time, the Blessed One, having entered into the wheel of Dharma, proclaimed the Dharma for the sake of making it heard, and so he proclaimed the sound of the hammer. Therefore it is said:

original: chos kyi gand'i zhes so //
analyzed: chos kyi gand'i zhes so //
translated: The sound of the hammer of Dharma.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, he also states the distinction:

original: sgra po zhes te /
analyzed: sgra po zhes te /
translated: The great sound.

original: chen po yang de yin la sgra yang de nyid yin la sgra yang de nyid yin pas sgra bo che'o //
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la sgra yang de nyid yin la sgra yang de nyid yin pas sgra bo che'o //
translated: It is great and it is sound, thus it is the great sound.

original: des ni yang 'di skad gsungs par gyur te /
analyzed: des ni yang 'di skad gsungs par gyur te /
translated: This is what he said:üîΩThe great sound of the hammer of Dharma.

original: chos kyi dung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid bcom ldan 'das su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid bcom ldan 'das su shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the Blessed One is the very nature of the Dharma conch, etc.

original: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
analyzed: mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po //
translated: Not dwelling in samsara or nirvana,

original: phyogs bcur chos kyi rda bo che //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs bcur chos kyi rda bo che // zhes pa ni /
translated: the great Dharma drum in the ten directions.

original: de la mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po ni srid pa'i 'khor ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ltar de dag la mi gnas pas gnyis la gnas pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi gnas mya ngan 'das pa po ni srid pa'i 'khor ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du rgyun chad med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ltar de dag la mi gnas pas gnyis la gnas pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúnot dwelling in samsara or nirvana‚Äù means that he does not dwell in either of the two, since he does not dwell in samsara and nirvana as if they were separate.

original: srid pa la mi gnas te srid pa'i skyon gyis mgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa la mi gnas te srid pa'i skyon gyis mgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not dwell in samsara, because he is not soiled by the faults of samsara.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te /
translated: He is not in nirvana,

original: snying rjes gzhan dbang nyid kyis 'khor ba ji srid bar du cher gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rjes gzhan dbang nyid kyis 'khor ba ji srid bar du cher gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he dwells in samsara for a long time, as long as the world exists, through his compassion, which is the power of his vow.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: nyes pa mthong ba srid la min //
analyzed: nyes pa mthong ba srid la min //
translated: Seeing the faults, he is not in samsara;

original: snying rjes mya ngan 'das la min //
analyzed: snying rjes mya ngan 'das la min //
translated: Through compassion, he is not in nirvana.

original: gzhan gyi don 'byung mthong bas na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don 'byung mthong bas na /
translated: Seeing the appearance of the benefit for others,

original: @71b srid par zhugs shing mi bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: @71b srid par zhugs shing mi bzhugs pa'o //
translated: He does not remain in existence, nor does he not remain.

original: zhes so // des na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes so // des na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das par gsungs so //
translated: Thus, he is said to be in a non-abiding nirvana.

original: srid ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa de dag tu dbye bar rtog pa med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa gnyi gar yang dbyer med pa'i dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: srid ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa de dag tu dbye bar rtog pa med pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa gnyi gar yang dbyer med pa'i dmigs pa ste /
translated: Since he is free from the conceptualization of dividing existence and nirvana, he is of one taste in emptiness, and the two are undifferentiated in his perception.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /üîΩ'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa / 'khor ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i /
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩWhen the perfect pristine consciousness

original: gang tshe yang dag ye shes skyes //
analyzed: gang tshe yang dag ye shes skyes //
translated: of samsara and nirvana arises,

original: 'khor nyid mya ngan 'das pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor nyid mya ngan 'das pa ni /
translated: samsara itself is nirvana,

original: de tshe 'di yi 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tshe 'di yi 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: and then this is so.

original: zhes so // de 'dra ba'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes so // de 'dra ba'i bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal 'di ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: This Bhagavat Manjusri is said to be in a non-abiding nirvana.

original: phyogs bcur chos kyi rnga bo ni chos kyi rnga bo che ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcur chos kyi rnga bo ni chos kyi rnga bo che ste /
translated: The drum of dharma in the ten directions is the great drum of dharma.

original: phyogs bcud chos kyi rnga bo che bsgrags pa dang ldan pa de ni de ltar ro //
analyzed: phyogs bcud chos kyi rnga bo che bsgrags pa dang ldan pa de ni de ltar ro //
translated: Since the great drum of dharma resounds in the ten directions, it is like that.

original: gzugs med gzugs ldan dam pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs ldan dam pa ste /
translated: The supreme form of formlessness

original: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can yid las skyes // zhes pa ste /
translated: He is formless, yet has various forms, born of the mind.

original: de la gzugs med ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gzugs med ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the formless is the nature of the Dharma body.

original: gzugs ldan ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ldan ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one with form is the nature of the enjoyment body.

original: dam pa ste chos kyi rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa ste chos kyi rgyu mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The sublime one is the natural outflow of the Dharma.

original: sna tshogs gzugs can ni sbrul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs gzugs can ni sbrul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The one with various forms is the essence of the emanation body.

original: yid las kyes pa ni de dag gi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yid las kyes pa ni de dag gi ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Born of the mind is because they are the nature of gnosis.

original: de nyid kyis na gzugs kyi lus la sogs pa de rnams kyi chos 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi skur shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gzugs kyi lus la sogs pa de rnams kyi chos 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi skur shes par bya ste /
translated: For that very reason, these dharmas of theirs, the form bodies and so forth, should be known as the gnosis body of the bhagavƒÅn tathƒÅgatas.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir na bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //üîΩgzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal //üîΩgzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir na bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo // gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal // gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po //
translated: Because they are his nature, the bhagavƒÅn Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´.üîΩThe glory of the appearance of all forms,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: the bearer of all reflections.

original: de la gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de la gzugs rnams thams cad snang ba'i dpal ni 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: The glory of the appearance of all forms is due to the nature of the Subduer of the World.

original: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad snang ba'i dpal ni gzugs rnams thams cad du snang ba ste /üîΩgzugs rnams thams cad sngags ba'i dpal de dang gang ldan pa de ni de ltar ro //üîΩgzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po ni ma lus pa rnams kyi gzugs brnyan ni gzugs brnyan ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad snang ba'i dpal ni gzugs rnams thams cad du snang ba ste / gzugs rnams thams cad sngags ba'i dpal de dang gang ldan pa de ni de ltar ro // gzugs brnyan ma lus 'chang ba po ni ma lus pa rnams kyi gzugs brnyan ni gzugs brnyan ma lus pa'o //
translated: The glory of the appearance of all kinds of forms is the appearance of all forms.üîΩThe glory of the appearance of all forms is the glory of the appearance of all forms.üîΩThe bearer of all reflections is the bearer of all reflections.

original: de 'dzin pas na gzugs brnyan ma lus 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas na gzugs brnyan ma lus 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the bearer of all reflections because he holds all reflections.

original: tshugs pa med cing cher grags pa //
analyzed: tshugs pa med cing cher grags pa //
translated: He is unassailable and greatly renowned.

original: khams gsum dbang phyug chen po ste //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: khams gsum dbang phyug chen po ste // zhes pa ni /
translated: He is the great lord of the three realms.

original: de la tshugs pa med pa ni gzhan rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩcher grags pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs mi @72a * //
analyzed: de la tshugs pa med pa ni gzhan rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pa nyid kyi phyir ro // cher grags pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs mi @72a * //
translated: He is unassailable because he is not overcome by others.

original: zad pa'i tshogs bsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad pa'i tshogs bsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is greatly renowned because he has accumulated the inexhaustible accumulation of the accumulation of merit.

original: khams gsum dbang phyug chen po ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni khams gsum ste /
analyzed: khams gsum dbang phyug chen po ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa ni khams gsum ste /
translated: The great lord of the three realms is the great lord of the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: khams gsum po nyid ni khams gsum pa ste khams gsum der dbang phug chen po ni chen po yang de yin la dbang phyug kyang de yin pas dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: khams gsum po nyid ni khams gsum pa ste khams gsum der dbang phug chen po ni chen po yang de yin la dbang phyug kyang de yin pas dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: The three realms are the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness. The great lord of those three realms is the great lord of the three realms.

original: 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas //üîΩdar ba chen po chos kyi tog //
analyzed: 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas // dar ba chen po chos kyi tog //
translated: He abides in the exalted path,

original: ces pa ni /üîΩde la 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni / de la 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas pa ni /
translated: the great prosperity of the Dharma‚Äôs crest.

original: yang dag par mtho zhing bstod par gyur pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po gang yin pa de ni 'phags lam shin tu mtho ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par mtho zhing bstod par gyur pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po gang yin pa de ni 'phags lam shin tu mtho ba ste /
translated: The exalted path is the eightfold path of the noble ones, which is exalted and praised.

original: de la gnas pa ni 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas so //üîΩdar ba chen po ni de las 'byung bas na dar ba ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni 'phags lam shin tu mtho la gnas so // dar ba chen po ni de las 'byung bas na dar ba ste /
translated: He abides in that exalted path.üîΩThe great prosperity is the prosperity that arises from that.

original: chen po yang de yin la dar ba yang de nyid yin pas dar ba chen po ste /
analyzed: chen po yang de yin la dar ba yang de nyid yin pas dar ba chen po ste /
translated: It is great and it is prosperity, thus it is great prosperity.

original: cher 'phel ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: cher 'phel ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means ‚Äúgreatly increased.‚Äù

original: chos kyi tog ni chos rnams kyi tog ste /
analyzed: chos kyi tog ni chos rnams kyi tog ste /
translated: Dharmadhvaja means ‚Äúbanner of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means ‚Äúbanner of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig / gnas brtan rgan po skye dgu'i bdag / ces pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig / gnas brtan rgan po skye dgu'i bdag / ces pa ni /
translated: The one youth in the three worlds, the elder, the aged, the lord of beings.

original: de la 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig ni gong nas gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig ni gong nas gsungs pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: Therein, the three worlds are as stated above.

original: de la gcig su gnyis su med pa kho nar gzhon nu'i lus dang 'dra ba'i sku dang ldan pa de ni 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig go //
analyzed: de la gcig su gnyis su med pa kho nar gzhon nu'i lus dang 'dra ba'i sku dang ldan pa de ni 'jig rten gsum na gzhon lus gcig go //
translated: The one in them is the one who is not a second, who has a body like a youth. He is the one youth in the three worlds.

original: gnas brtan ni nyan thos la sogs pa de rnams la de'i chos nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas brtan ni nyan thos la sogs pa de rnams la de'i chos nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elder is the elder of those ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: rgan po ni rang sangs rgyas kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i chos ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgan po ni rang sangs rgyas kyi mchog nyid kyi phyir dang / de'i chos ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The aged is the supreme pratyekabuddha, because of his teaching of that Dharma.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po ni so so so sor skye bas na skye dgu ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po ni so so so sor skye bas na skye dgu ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The lord of beings is the bodhisattvas, because they are born separately.

original: de rnams kyi bdag ni skye dgu'i bdag ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag ni skye dgu'i bdag ste /
translated: The lord of these is the lord of beings.

original: rje bo ni 'jam dpal nyid do //
analyzed: rje bo ni 'jam dpal nyid do //
translated: The master is Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ himself.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chad pa //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chad pa //
translated: The explanation of the thirty-two marks:

original: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes //üîΩzhes pa ni /üîΩde la sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa nyid dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bar 'brel ba nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sdu gu 'jig rten gsum na mdzes // zhes pa ni / de la sum cu rtsa gnyis mtshan 'chang ba ni phyag dang zhabs 'khor lo'i mtshan dang ldan pa nyid dang / zhabs shin tu gnas pa nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs kyi sor mo dra bar 'brel ba nyid dang / phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing gzhon sha chags pa nyid dang /
translated: Handsome, delightful in the three worlds.üîΩRegarding this, bearing the thirty-two marks is having the mark of wheels on the hands and feet,üîΩhaving very steady feet, having fingers and toes connected by webs, having hands and feet that are soft and youthful,üîΩhaving long fingers and toes, having broad heels, having a large and erect body, having ankles that do not protrude, having body hairs that point upward, having long and beautiful arms,

original: bdun ma thob nyid dang / sor mo ring ba nyid dang / rting ba yangs pa nyid dang / sku che @72b zhing drang ba nyid dang / zhabs long bu mi mngon pa nyid dang / sku'i sbu gyen du phyogs pa nyid dang / phyag ring zhing mdzes pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bdun ma thob nyid dang / sor mo ring ba nyid dang / rting ba yangs pa nyid dang / sku che @72b zhing drang ba nyid dang / zhabs long bu mi mngon pa nyid dang / sku'i sbu gyen du phyogs pa nyid dang / phyag ring zhing mdzes pa nyid dang /
translated: having a broad and beautiful body, having a beautiful chest, having a beautiful jaw like a lion, having a perfectly round face, having a beautiful face, having a beautiful smile, having a beautiful tongue, having a beautiful voice, having eyes that are the color of blue lotuses, having a beautiful forehead, having a beautiful head, and having a beautiful ushnisha.

original: mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa nyid dang / mdog gser dang 'dra ba nyid dang / bags pa srab ba nyid dang / sbu re re nas g-yas su 'khyil ba nyid dang / zhal mdzod sbus brgyan ba nyid dang / ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba nyid dang /üîΩdpung mgo shin tu zlum pa nyid dang / thal gong rgyas pa nyid dang / ro bro ba'i mchog mkhyen pa nyid dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa nyid dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa nyid dang / ljags ring ba nyid dang /
analyzed: mdoms kyi sba ba sbubs su nub pa nyid dang / mdog gser dang 'dra ba nyid dang / bags pa srab ba nyid dang / sbu re re nas g-yas su 'khyil ba nyid dang / zhal mdzod sbus brgyan ba nyid dang / ro stod seng ge'i 'dra ba nyid dang / dpung mgo shin tu zlum pa nyid dang / thal gong rgyas pa nyid dang / ro bro ba'i mchog mkhyen pa nyid dang / shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa nyid dang / dbu gtsug tor dang ldan pa nyid dang / ljags ring ba nyid dang /
translated: His sexual organ is concealed in a sheath. His complexion is like gold. His skin is very fine. Each of his body hairs curls to the right. His face is adorned with a hair coil. His upper body is like a lion‚Äôs.üîΩHis shoulders are very round. His chest is broad. He knows the best of tastes. His body is as broad as it is tall, like the banyan tree. His head has a crown protrusion. His tongue is long.

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa nyid dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba nyid dang / tshems dkar ba nyid dang / tshems mnyam pa nyid dang / tshems thags bzang ba nyid dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba nyid dang / spyan mthon mthing dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa nyid dang / 'gram pa seng ge'i 'dra ba nyid dang / tshems dkar ba nyid dang / tshems mnyam pa nyid dang / tshems thags bzang ba nyid dang / tshems bzhi bcu mnga' ba nyid dang / spyan mthon mthing dang /
translated: He has a melodious voice like Brahma. His cheeks are like a lion‚Äôs. His teeth are white. His teeth are even. His teeth are without gaps. He has forty teeth. His eyes are deep blue.

original: rdzi ma ba'i lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: rdzi ma ba'i lta bu nyid do //
translated: It is like the mark of a cowherd.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis de rnams 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal bo dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang mi mnyam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i khes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams ni 'od 'bar ba dang /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis de rnams 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal bo dang / nyan thos la sogs pa dang mi mnyam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa bon las byung ba'i khes bu chen po'i mtshan rnams ni 'od 'bar ba dang /
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great person are not the same as those of a universal monarch, a disciple, etc. The marks of a great person that arise from the seed of omniscience are radiant,

original: rdzogs pa dang / gsal la gnas par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa dang / gsal la gnas par gyur ba yin no //
translated: complete, and clear.

original: de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsungs pa /üîΩgsal la gnas pa 'phags 'bar ba //
analyzed: de ltar yang chos mngon pa las gsungs pa / gsal la gnas pa 'phags 'bar ba //
translated: Thus it is said in the Abhidharma:üîΩClear, complete, and bright

original: rdzogs pa'i mtshan ni thub chen gyi //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i mtshan ni thub chen gyi //
translated: are the marks of the Great Sage.

original: zhes so // sdu gu ni sdug pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // sdu gu ni sdug pa ste /
translated: Lovely means beautiful.

original: 'dod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba ste /
translated: It is desirable

original: sems can thams cad kyis 'dun pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis 'dun pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates longing in all sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten gsum na mdzes pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na mdzes pa ni //
translated: Beautiful in the three worlds

original: 'jig rten gsum ni gong ma bzhin no //üîΩde la mdzes pa ni blta na sdug pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum ni gong ma bzhin no // de la mdzes pa ni blta na sdug pa ste /
translated: The three worlds are as above.üîΩBeautiful means lovely.

original: blta bas mi ngoms pa'i gzugs can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: blta bas mi ngoms pa'i gzugs can gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is a form that is never satiated by looking at it.

original: de la blta bas mi ngoms pa ni rten gyi khyad par nyid las blta bas mi bra bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la blta bas mi ngoms pa ni rten gyi khyad par nyid las blta bas mi bra bar shes par bya ste /
translated: His body is never satiating to behold, because of the excellence of his support.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag dang nyid lag de ni dus ring du lta na yang sngon ma mthong ba bzhin du mthong la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag dang nyid lag de ni dus ring du lta na yang sngon ma mthong ba bzhin du mthong la /
translated: The limbs and minor limbs of the Lord, even when seen for a long time, are seen as if unseen before.

original: dga' bas blta bas mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bas blta bas mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: One never tires of beholding him with joy.

original: blta bas mi ngoms pa'i gzugs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: blta bas mi ngoms pa'i gzugs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is the body never satiating to behold.

original: 'jig rten shes legs slob dpon te //
analyzed: 'jig rten shes legs slob dpon te //
translated: He is the teacher of the world‚Äôs good knowledge.

original: 'jig rten slob dpon 'jig pa med //üîΩces pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten slob dpon 'jig pa med // ces pa ni /
translated: The world‚Äôs teacher is imperishable.

original: de la 'jig rten shes legs slob dpon ni shes pa dang / legs pa rnams ni shes @73a * //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten shes legs slob dpon ni shes pa dang / legs pa rnams ni shes @73a * //
translated: He is the teacher of the world‚Äôs good knowledge.

original: legs so // 'jig rten rnams kyi shes legs ni 'jig rten shes legs te /
analyzed: legs so // 'jig rten rnams kyi shes legs ni 'jig rten shes legs te /
translated: The world‚Äôs good knowledge is the world‚Äôs good knowledge.

original: de rnams kyi slob dpon ni bcom ldan 'das zhes so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi slob dpon ni bcom ldan 'das zhes so //
translated: The teacher of that is the Lord.

original: 'jig rten slob dpon ni lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i lam nye bar ston pas na 'jig rten slob dpon zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten slob dpon ni lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams la skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du dam pa'i lam nye bar ston pas na 'jig rten slob dpon zhes gsungs so //
translated: The world-teacher is so called because he teaches the path of the holy life to gods, men, etc., in accordance with their lot.

original: 'jigs pa med pa ni sprul pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs bstan pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba'i don ma lus pa'i phyir na 'jigs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa ni sprul pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs bstan pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba'i don ma lus pa'i phyir na 'jigs pa med pa ste /
translated: He is fearless because he has no fear of not being able to accomplish the total welfare of all beings by means of the display of various emanations.

original: bag tsha ba med pa'i don to //üîΩmgon skyob 'jig rten yid gcugs pa //
analyzed: bag tsha ba med pa'i don to // mgon skyob 'jig rten yid gcugs pa //
translated: The meaning of fearless is without anxiety.üîΩHe is the protector, the refuge, the supreme resort

original: skyabs dang skyob ba bla na med //üîΩces pa ni /
analyzed: skyabs dang skyob ba bla na med // ces pa ni /
translated: of the world, which is without protection.

original: de la mgon ni mgon med pa'i sems can 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying ba rnams kyi mgon du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mgon ni mgon med pa'i sems can 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor bying ba rnams kyi mgon du gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the protector because he is the protector of beings who are without a protector and who are drowning in the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: skyabs ni skyabs 'dod pa rnams skyob pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩ'jig rten gsum gyi yid gcugs pa ni //
analyzed: skyabs ni skyabs 'dod pa rnams skyob pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro // 'jig rten gsum gyi yid gcugs pa ni //
translated: He is the refuge because he is the very essence of the refuge for those who desire a refuge.

original: 'jig rten yid gcugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten yid gcugs pa ste /
translated: He is the friend of the worldüîΩbecause he is the friend of the world.

original: rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid chen po rab tu bstan pa nyid kyis lta ba ngan pa'i thibs po'i 'gro ba ma lus pa 'joms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid chen po rab tu bstan pa nyid kyis lta ba ngan pa'i thibs po'i 'gro ba ma lus pa 'joms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the great emptiness in every way, because it is the teaching of the great emptiness itself, and it is the destroyer of the entire darkness of bad views.

original: skyabs ni skyabs 'dod pa'i sems can rnams kyi skyabs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skyabs ni skyabs 'dod pa'i sems can rnams kyi skyabs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the refuge, because it is the refuge of beings who desire a refuge.

original: skyob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skyob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the protector, because it is the unbroken lineage of the Tathagatas.

original: bla na med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the unsurpassed, because it is the attainment of the unsurpassed knowledge of all the Tathagatas.

original: nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod //
analyzed: nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod //
translated: The enjoyment of space is the correct enjoyment.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtsho //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtsho // zhes pa ni /
translated: The ocean of omniscient knowledge.

original: de la nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rjes su longs spyod pa ni legs par gnas pa'i ye shes kyi mthu'o //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rjes su longs spyod pa ni legs par gnas pa'i ye shes kyi mthu'o //
translated: Here, the enjoyment of space is the correct enjoyment. The enjoyment of the equality of space is the power of the knowledge of correct abiding.

original: yang dag par longs spyod pa ni yang dag par longs spyod de /
analyzed: yang dag par longs spyod pa ni yang dag par longs spyod de /
translated: He enjoys the enjoyment, i.e., he enjoys the enjoyment.

original: nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod do //
translated: He enjoys the enjoyment of space.

original: nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod ni khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal srid la dbang sgyur ba'i gtso bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i longs spyod yang dag spyod ni khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal srid la dbang sgyur ba'i gtso bo'i phyir ro //
translated: He enjoys the enjoyment of space because he is the chief of the sovereignty of the Dharma of the three realms.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtsho ni thams cad mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa ste //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mtsho ni thams cad mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa ste //
translated: The ocean of the knowledge of omniscience is omniscience because it is all-knowing.

original: de'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes te /
translated: His knowledge is the knowledge of omniscience.

original: zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes so //
translated: It is the knowledge of extinction and non-arising.

original: de nyid mtsho ste shin tu rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid mtsho ste shin tu rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is an ocean because it is extremely vast.

original: ma rig sgo nga'i sbubs 'byed pa //üîΩsrid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa po //
analyzed: ma rig sgo nga'i sbubs 'byed pa // srid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa po //
translated: He splits the egg of ignorance.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: He destroys the net of existence.

original: de la ma rig pa ni las dang 'bras bu bden @73b pa dang dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi gti mug ste /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni las dang 'bras bu bden @73b pa dang dkon mchog rnams mi shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi gti mug ste /
translated: Therein, ignorance is delusion in the nature of not knowing karma, its effects, the truths, and the jewels.

original: de nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dang po nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gro ba 'byung ba'i rgyud nyid kyi phyir na ma rig sgo nga'i sbubs zhes gsungs so //üîΩde 'byed pa ni 'joms pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dang po nyid kyi phyir dang / 'gro ba 'byung ba'i rgyud nyid kyi phyir na ma rig sgo nga'i sbubs zhes gsungs so // de 'byed pa ni 'joms pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is called the ‚Äúegg of ignorance‚Äù because it is the first of dependent originations and because it is the continuum of the origin of the world.

original: 'dral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dral ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is the ‚Äúbreaker‚Äù because it has the nature of breaking through.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na /üîΩsrid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa po //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na / srid pa'i dra ba 'joms pa po //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: it is the destroyer of the net of existence.

original: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Existence is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de nyid dra ba ste mi thar ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dra ba ste mi thar ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is a net because it is a state of non-liberation.

original: de 'joms pa ni yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pas mchog tu yongs su mthar phyin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'joms pa ni yang dag pa'i don bsgoms pas mchog tu yongs su mthar phyin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Its destruction is the supreme and ultimate attainment through the meditation on the meaning of reality.

original: nyon mongs lus zhi byed pa ;üîΩ/'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol phyin //
analyzed: nyon mongs lus zhi byed pa ; /'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol phyin //
translated: It is the pacifier of the body of afflictions,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: the one who has gone to the other side of the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: de la nyon mongs pa ma lus pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa ma lus pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the afflictions are of three kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The defilement of defilement, the defilement of action, and the defilement of birth.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang ; sred pa dang / len pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang ; sred pa dang / len pa'o //
translated: The defilement of defilement is ignorance, craving, and grasping.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed dang / srid pa'o //
translated: The defilement of action is the formative forces and becoming.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The defilement of birth is the remaining members.

original: yang nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang nas nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, the defilement is twofold:

original: rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: the defilement as cause and the defilement as result.

original: de la rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi rang bzhin gyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi rang bzhin gyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: The defilement as cause consists of the members that are of the nature of defilement and action.

original: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The defilement as result consists of the remaining members.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun ni rgyu rnams pa bdun te /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun ni rgyu rnams pa bdun te /
translated: Alternatively, the seven kinds of defilement are the seven causes.

original: phyin ci log pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i rgyu ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The cause of error is ignorance.

original: brag pa med pa'i rgyu ni 'du byed do //
analyzed: brag pa med pa'i rgyu ni 'du byed do //
translated: The cause of non-separation is the formative forces.

original: nye bar sbyor ba'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The cause of connection is consciousness.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug go //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug go //
translated: The cause of appropriation is name-and-form and the six sense-fields.

original: nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu ni reg pa dang tshor ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu ni reg pa dang tshor ba'o //
translated: The cause of experience is contact and feeling.

original: 'dren pa'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i rgyu ni sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa'o //
translated: The cause of guidance is craving, grasping, and becoming.

original: yid 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba dang / rga shi ste /
analyzed: yid 'byung ba'i rgyu ni skye ba dang / rga shi ste /
translated: The cause of disgust is birth, old age, and death.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba'o //
translated: These addictions arise from false imagination.

original: ma lus zhi byed ni ma lus mi lus pa'o nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang gang ldan pa de ni de ltar ro //
analyzed: ma lus zhi byed ni ma lus mi lus pa'o nyon mongs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba dang gang ldan pa de ni de ltar ro //
translated: The cause of the complete pacification of all addictions is the complete pacification of all addictions.

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i tshor ba rgyu dang bcas pa'i don de /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na /

analyzed: snying rjes dbang med bcom ldan smos ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to speak of the compassionate one who is not in control?üîΩ

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: What need to speak of the compassionate one, who is not independent?

original: sems can 'dul dbang gis mi gyo ba rnams kyi gzugs kyis kyang so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can 'dul dbang gis mi gyo ba rnams kyi gzugs kyis kyang so sor snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the form of those who are unmoved by the power of disciplining sentient beings, they appear individually.

original: byed pa skal ba ji lta ba dang bsam pa'i dbang nyid kyis chos nye bar ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa skal ba ji lta ba dang bsam pa'i dbang nyid kyis chos nye bar ston pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the power of the teaching of the Dharma according to the fortune and intention of the disciples.

original: phan 'dogs pa ni phyi mar phan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ni phyi mar phan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Beneficial is the benefit in the future.

original: de ston pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ston pa'i tshul dang gang ldan pa de phan 'dogs so //
translated: He who has the method of teaching that is beneficial.

original: sems can mnyes gshin pa ni 'gro ba la bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mnyes gshin pa ni 'gro ba la bu gcig pa bzhin du byams pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Loving to sentient beings is the love for the world like that for an only child.

original: bzang ngan shes shing dus shes la //
analyzed: bzang ngan shes shing dus shes la //
translated: Knowing good and bad, knowing the time,

original: khyab bdag dam shes dam tshig ldan ;üîΩ/ zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khyab bdag dam shes dam tshig ldan ; / zhes pa ni /
translated: the lord of the good, knowing the good, endowed with the good.

original: de la bzang ngan shes shing ni bzang po dang ngan pa ni bzang ngan te /
analyzed: de la bzang ngan shes shing ni bzang po dang ngan pa ni bzang ngan te /
translated: Among them, knowing good and bad is good and bad.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don to //
translated: It means virtue and non-virtue.

original: de mkhyen pas na bzang ngan shes pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: de mkhyen pas na bzang ngan shes pa bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
translated: He is the Bhagavat Manjusri, who knows good and bad, because he knows that.

original: kha cig tu mi dge ba yang shes te /
analyzed: kha cig tu mi dge ba yang shes te /
translated: In some cases, he knows what is nonvirtuous,

original: sems can gyi don gyi dbang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don gyi dbang gi phyir ro //
translated: because of the power of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa ;
translated: Thus it is said:

original: / snying brtser byas na nyes ba mad //
analyzed: / snying brtser byas na nyes ba mad //
translated: If one acts with compassion, there is no fault.

original: ces so // dus shes pa ni dus mkhyen pas na dus shes pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // dus shes pa ni dus mkhyen pas na dus shes pa'o //
translated: Knowing the time means knowing the time, because he knows the time.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i dus so //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the time to engage.

original: 'di ni chos bstan pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos bstan pa'i dus so //
translated: This is the time to teach the Dharma.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i dus so //
translated: This is the time to benefit sentient beings.

original: 'di ni btang snyoms kyi dus so //
analyzed: 'di ni btang snyoms kyi dus so //
translated: This is the time for equanimity.üîΩThis is the time for nirvana.

original: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus so zhes de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus so zhes de lta bu'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Such is the concordant aspect.

original: khyad bdag gi don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: khyad bdag gi don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the individual has been explained.

original: dam shes ni snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / sngags dang / rig pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid shes shing rtogs pas na dam shes so //
analyzed: dam shes ni snying po dang / phyag rgya dang / sngags dang / rig pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid shes shing rtogs pas na dam shes so //
translated: Knowing the pledge means knowing and realizing the essence of the essence, the seal, the mantra, and the knowledge-woman.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na dam tshig ldan zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na dam tshig ldan zhes so //
translated: For that very reason, he is called the one with the pledge.

original: dus shes sems can dbang don shes //üîΩrnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po //
analyzed: dus shes sems can dbang don shes // rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po //
translated: He knows the time, the faculties and aims of beings,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: And is skilled in the three liberations.

original: de la dus shes ni dus rnams shes pas dus shes te /
analyzed: de la dus shes ni dus rnams shes pas dus shes te /
translated: He knows the time, because he knows the times.

original: slong ba'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes nas dus su sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa ni mi zad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsems can dbang don shes ni sems can rnams kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: slong ba'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa shes nas dus su sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyin pa ni mi zad pa'i phyir ro // sems can dbang don shes ni sems can rnams kyi dbang po ste /
translated: He gives at the right time, knowing the wishes of beings who are petitioners, because his giving and so forth are inexhaustible.

original: sems can thams cad dang 'brel ba'i dbang po rtul bo la sogs pa de rnams mkhyen pas na sems can dbang po shes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang 'brel ba'i dbang po rtul bo la sogs pa de rnams mkhyen pas na sems can dbang po shes so //
translated: He knows the faculties and aims of beings. He knows the faculties of beings, because he knows the dull, sharp, etc. faculties of all beings.

original: rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnam par grol ba gsum gyi char brtag pa'i mtshan nyid la zhib tu mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir na mkhas pa po zhes gsungs @76a * //üîΩso ; / yon tan ldan zhing yon tan shes //
analyzed: rnam grol gsum la mkhas pa po ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnam par grol ba gsum gyi char brtag pa'i mtshan nyid la zhib tu mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyir na mkhas pa po zhes gsungs @76a * // so ; / yon tan ldan zhing yon tan shes //
translated: He is skilled in the three liberations, because he is skilled in the characteristics of the three liberations of the sravakas and so forth.

original: chos shes bkra shis 'byung //
analyzed: chos shes bkra shis 'byung //
translated: He is endowed with good qualities and knows good qualities,üîΩAnd is skilled in the auspicious.

original: zhes pa ni de la yon tan ldan zhing ni rang gi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de la yon tan ldan zhing ni rang gi'o //
translated: He is endowed with good qualities, his own.

original: yon tan shes ni phyi rol pa dang / nyan thos pa rnams kyi yon tan mkhyen pas na yon tan shes so //
analyzed: yon tan shes ni phyi rol pa dang / nyan thos pa rnams kyi yon tan mkhyen pas na yon tan shes so //
translated: Knowing good qualities, he knows the good qualities of outsiders and of sravakas.

original: chos shes ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams mkhyen pas na chos shes so //
analyzed: chos shes ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams mkhyen pas na chos shes so //
translated: Knowing Dharma, he knows mundane and supramundane Dharmas.

original: bkra shis ni thun mong ma yin pa'i skyes bu chen po la sogs pa'i mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkra shis ni thun mong ma yin pa'i skyes bu chen po la sogs pa'i mtshan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Auspicious, he is endowed with the marks of an extraordinary great being, and so forth.

original: bkra shis 'byung ni 'di las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bkra shis 'byung ni 'di las 'byung ba ste /
translated: Source of auspiciousness, he is the source of that.

original: 'jig rten la sogs pa'i bkra shis rnams de las byung bas na bkra shis 'byung ste ;
analyzed: 'jig rten la sogs pa'i bkra shis rnams de las byung bas na bkra shis 'byung ste ;
translated: The auspiciousness of the world and so forth comes from him, so he is the source of auspiciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
translated: The Bhagavat Manjusri.

original: bkra shis kun gyi bkra shis snyan grags dge //
analyzed: bkra shis kun gyi bkra shis snyan grags dge //
translated: Auspiciousness of all auspiciousness, virtuous fame,

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is

original: de la bkra shis kun gyi bkra shis pa ni bkra shis kyi nang nas legs pa bkra shis so //
analyzed: de la bkra shis kun gyi bkra shis pa ni bkra shis kyi nang nas legs pa bkra shis so //
translated: the auspiciousness of auspiciousness among auspiciousnesses.

original: bkra shis kun te shin tu dga' bar byed pa'i nang nas bkra shis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkra shis kun te shin tu dga' bar byed pa'i nang nas bkra shis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Auspiciousness is the most auspicious of all auspicious things, because it brings about the highest joy.

original: grags pa ni rgyal bu thams cad sgrol dang / ri bong gi lus kyis rmad du byung ba du mas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir na deng sang yang mi nyams par grags pa zhes ba ni bcom ldan 'das de'i ste /
analyzed: grags pa ni rgyal bu thams cad sgrol dang / ri bong gi lus kyis rmad du byung ba du mas sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir na deng sang yang mi nyams par grags pa zhes ba ni bcom ldan 'das de'i ste /
translated: Glory is the glory of the Blessed One, because he is glorious with the glory of the Bodhisattva Liberator of All and with the many wonders of his body as a rabbit, and because he benefits sentient beings.

original: de'i mi zad pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbkra shis ni sems rtse gcig tu bsgom pa la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bu la sogs pa rnams kyi phun phum  tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir na bkra shis te /
analyzed: de'i mi zad pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro // bkra shis ni sems rtse gcig tu bsgom pa la brtson pa'i rigs kyi bu la sogs pa rnams kyi phun phum  tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa nyid kyi phyir na bkra shis te /
translated: His body is imperishable, because it is inexhaustible.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal lo //
translated: Auspiciousness is the Blessed One Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, because he is the basis of all the prosperity of sons of noble family and so forth who strive to cultivate one-pointed concentration.

original: snyan grags ni sbyin pa la sogs pa mchog tu yongs su mthar phyir dang / dri ma'i skyon thams cad med pa'i phyir dang / dri ma med pa'i grags pa'i phung po nyid kyi phyir na yang snyan grags zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snyan grags ni sbyin pa la sogs pa mchog tu yongs su mthar phyir dang / dri ma'i skyon thams cad med pa'i phyir dang / dri ma med pa'i grags pa'i phung po nyid kyi phyir na yang snyan grags zhes gsungs so //
translated: Fame is so called because it is the supreme culmination of generosity and so forth, because it is free from all faults of stains, and because it is the very mass of stainless fame.

original: dge zhes pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩdbugs 'byin chen po dga' ston che //
analyzed: dge zhes pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro // dbugs 'byin chen po dga' ston che //
translated: Virtue is so called because it is the nature of the path of the ten virtues.üîΩGreat relief, great festival,

original: dga' chen rol mo chen po ste //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: dga' chen rol mo chen po ste // zhes pa ni /
translated: great joy, great play.

original: de la dbugs 'byin chen po ni dbugs 'byin pas na dbugs 'byin pa ste ;
analyzed: de la dbugs 'byin chen po ni dbugs 'byin pas na dbugs 'byin pa ste ;
translated: Here, great relief is relief, because it is a relief.

original: dbugs 'byin pa yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas dbugs 'byin chen po ste /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas dbugs 'byin chen po ste /
translated: It is a relief and it is great, therefore it is great relief.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams la yang dag par dbugs 'byin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa la mos pa'i sems can rnams la yang dag par dbugs 'byin pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is so called because it is the true relief of sentient beings who are devoted to desire and so on, through the samadhis of glorious Vajrasattva and so on.

original: dga' ston che @76b ni dga' ba yang de yin la chen po yang de yin bas dga' ston che ste /
analyzed: dga' ston che @76b ni dga' ba yang de yin la chen po yang de yin bas dga' ston che ste /
translated: The great festival is the great joy.

original: mchod sbyin mchog tu gsungs so //üîΩlo re rjes mthun dad pa yis //
analyzed: mchod sbyin mchog tu gsungs so // lo re rjes mthun dad pa yis //
translated: It is said to be the supreme sacrifice.üîΩHe who, with faith,

original: gang zhig cho ga ji bzhin byed //
analyzed: gang zhig cho ga ji bzhin byed //
translated: performs the rite in accordance with the rule,

original: rtag tu mchod sbyin mchog tu bshad //
analyzed: rtag tu mchod sbyin mchog tu bshad //
translated: is always said to be the supreme sacrificer.

original: gzhan du thar pa'i lam du gshegs //
analyzed: gzhan du thar pa'i lam du gshegs //
translated: Otherwise, he goes on the path to liberation.

original: rtag tu mchod sbyin mchog rig pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mchod sbyin mchog rig pa'o //
translated: He is always known as the supreme sacrificer.

original: zhes te / rnam pa gnyis ka ltar yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal nyid mchog tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: zhes te / rnam pa gnyis ka ltar yang bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal nyid mchog tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: In both cases, the Lord Manjusri himself is supreme,

original: rtag tu sbyin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam nyid du gshegs pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gzhol bas na dga' ston che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyin pa la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rtag tu mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam nyid du gshegs pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gzhol bas na dga' ston che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is always engaged in giving, because he always goes on the path to nirvana, and because he is the great festival, since he is devoted to the side of virtue.

original: dga' chen ni dga' ba yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas dga' chen te /
analyzed: dga' chen ni dga' ba yang de yin la chen po yang de nyid yin pas dga' chen te /
translated: The great joy is the great joy.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi skal pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi gzugs nyid kyis bla na med pa'i chos ston par byed pas dga' ba skye pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi skal pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi gzugs nyid kyis bla na med pa'i chos ston par byed pas dga' ba skye pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is the great performer because he teaches the unsurpassed Dharma with a body that is the fortune of the entire world.

original: rol mo chen po ste ni rol mo chen po'i dga' ba zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gang ldan pa de rol mo chen po ste bcom ldan 'das de'o //
analyzed: rol mo chen po ste ni rol mo chen po'i dga' ba zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang gang ldan pa de rol mo chen po ste bcom ldan 'das de'o //
translated: He is the great performance because he possesses the performance of great joy, which is characterized by the absence of outflows.

original: bkur sti rim gro phun sum tshogs /
analyzed: bkur sti rim gro phun sum tshogs /
translated: He is the perfection of worship and service.

original: mchog tu dga' ba grags bdag dpal //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba grags bdag dpal // zhes pa ni /
translated: He is the glory of supreme joy, the lord of fame.

original: de la bkur sti ni khams gsum du dam pa'i bkur sti dang mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la bkur sti ni khams gsum du dam pa'i bkur sti dang mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Worship is the worship and offering to the highest in the three realms.

original: byed pa ni rim gro ste /
analyzed: byed pa ni rim gro ste /
translated: Service is the performance of that.

original: rim gro mchog ni nyan thos la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi mchod pa ji ltar 'os pa grub pas na dam pa ste /
analyzed: rim gro mchog ni nyan thos la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams kyi mchod pa ji ltar 'os pa grub pas na dam pa ste /
translated: The supreme service is the best because it accomplishes the worship of those who are worthy of worship, such as the sravakas and so forth.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rim gro mchog gi lung dpog dang / ji bzhin yan lag bcas par rig / sngags don yang ni rnam par dpyad //
analyzed: rim gro mchog gi lung dpog dang / ji bzhin yan lag bcas par rig / sngags don yang ni rnam par dpyad //
translated: and the supreme service, the prediction, and the analysis of the scriptures, and the meaning of the mantras.

original: rim gro mchog tu de brjod do //
analyzed: rim gro mchog tu de brjod do //
translated: It is said to be supreme service.

original: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yang mchog byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes so // bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal yang mchog byed pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One is also supreme in action.

original: don dam pa'i rig pa dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi lung dpog pa dang / sngags thams cad kyi don rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir na yang mchog ces gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rig pa dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi lung dpog pa dang / sngags thams cad kyi don rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir na yang mchog ces gsungs so //
translated: Because of the supreme knowledge, the prediction of the scriptures, and the analysis of the meaning of all mantras, it is said to be supreme.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the nature of the support for all perfections.

original: mchog tu dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Supreme joy is the nature of all joys.

original: grags bdag dpal zhes pa la /
analyzed: grags bdag dpal zhes pa la /
translated: The one who is the lord of glory and splendor.

original: dpal ni lha mo ste /
analyzed: dpal ni lha mo ste /
translated: Splendor is the goddess.

original: de'i grags pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba rnams so //
analyzed: de'i grags pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba rnams so //
translated: Her glory is bliss and mental bliss.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ste /
translated: He is the lord of those.

original: gtso bo ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: gtso bo ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The principal one is the Blessed One.

original: mchog ldan mchog sbyin gtso bo ste //üîΩskyabs kyi @77a * //
analyzed: mchog ldan mchog sbyin gtso bo ste // skyabs kyi @77a * //
translated: 1. He is the best of the best, the bestower of the best, the chief,

original: dam pa skyabs su 'os //üîΩzhes pa ni /
analyzed: dam pa skyabs su 'os // zhes pa ni /
translated: the best of refuges, worthy of refuge.

original: de la mchog ldan ni mngon par 'gro bar bya ba rnams kyi nang na mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mchog ldan ni mngon par 'gro bar bya ba rnams kyi nang na mchog nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is the best of the best because he is the best of those who are to be gone to.

original: mchog sbyin ni mchog sbyin pas na mchog sbyin te /
analyzed: mchog sbyin ni mchog sbyin pas na mchog sbyin te /
translated: He is the bestower of the best because he bestows the best,

original: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: fulfilling the wishes of all.

original: gtso bo ste ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyi nang na mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ste ni phyi rol pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad kyi nang na mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the chief because he is the best of all the non-Buddhists and Buddhists.

original: skyabs su 'os pa ni dman zhing sdug bsngal ba dang skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skyabs su 'os pa ni dman zhing sdug bsngal ba dang skyabs med pa rnams kyi skyabs su 'os pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He is worthy of refuge because he is the refuge of those who are lowly, suffering, and without refuge.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na skyabs kyi dam pa'o //
translated: For that very reason he is the best of refuges.

original: 'jigs chen dgra ste rab kyi mchog /'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po //üîΩzhes ba ni /
analyzed: 'jigs chen dgra ste rab kyi mchog /'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po //üîΩzhes ba ni /
translated: 2. He is the great enemy of fear, the best of the best, the remover of all fears.

original: de la 'jigs chen dgra ni gnam gyis bskos pa la sogs pa 'jigs pa chen po brgyad de /
analyzed: de la 'jigs chen dgra ni gnam gyis bskos pa la sogs pa 'jigs pa chen po brgyad de /
translated: The great fearsome enemy is the eight great fears, such as being appointed by the gods,

original: nad dang / 'chi ba dang / mu ge dang / me dang / chu dang / srin po dang / chag ba dang / byi ba rnams so //
analyzed: nad dang / 'chi ba dang / mu ge dang / me dang / chu dang / srin po dang / chag ba dang / byi ba rnams so //
translated: sickness, death, famine, fire, water, demons, lightning, and mice.

original: de rnams kyi dgra ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dgra ste /
translated: They are the enemy of those,

original: nad la sogs pa nges par 'joms pa nyid kyis yams dang nye bar 'tshe ba rnams zad par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nad la sogs pa nges par 'joms pa nyid kyis yams dang nye bar 'tshe ba rnams zad par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they definitely destroy sickness and so forth, and because they cause the exhaustion of epidemics and calamities.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na rab kyi mchog ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na rab kyi mchog ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, they are called the supreme of the best.

original: 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po ni lus pa med pa'i 'jigs pa chen po brgyad de /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po ni lus pa med pa'i 'jigs pa chen po brgyad de /
translated: The remover of all fears is the eight remaining great fears,

original: de dag ni seng ge dang / glang po che dang / me dang / sbrul dang / rkun ma dang / rgyal po'i chad pa dang / mtshon dang / lce 'bab pa rnams la sogs pa'o //üîΩ'jigs pa de rnams ma lus par sel bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: de dag ni seng ge dang / glang po che dang / me dang / sbrul dang / rkun ma dang / rgyal po'i chad pa dang / mtshon dang / lce 'bab pa rnams la sogs pa'o // 'jigs pa de rnams ma lus par sel bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: such as lions, elephants, fire, snakes, thieves, royal punishments, weapons, and lightning.üîΩBecause they completely remove those fears,

original: 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ma lus sel ba po ste /
translated: they are the remover of all fears.

original: bcom ldan 'jam dal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'jam dal te /
translated: The Blessed One is the Gentle Splendor.

original: de rje su dran pa rtsam gyis 'jigs pa ma lus pa zad par byed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de rje su dran pa rtsam gyis 'jigs pa ma lus pa zad par byed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because, by merely remembering him, all fear is destroyed.

original: da ni sems can thams cad la 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin gyis gang la gus pa rnams la de'i gzugs kyis kyang snang bar byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni sems can thams cad la 'gro ba 'dul ba'i rang bzhin gyis gang la gus pa rnams la de'i gzugs kyis kyang snang bar byed par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Now, in order to show that he appears in the form of those who are revered by all beings, by the nature of his training of the world,

original: gtsug phud phud bu lcang lo can //
analyzed: gtsug phud phud bu lcang lo can //
translated: he has a topknot, a topknot with a curl,

original: ral pa mu ni cod pan thogs //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: ral pa mu ni cod pan thogs // zhes pa ste /
translated: matted locks, a topknot with a crest,üîΩand a topknot with a diadem.

original: de la gtsug phud ni 'di la gtsug phud yod pas na gtsug phud can te /
analyzed: de la gtsug phud ni 'di la gtsug phud yod pas na gtsug phud can te /
translated: Among them, he has a topknot because he has a topknot.

original: kha cig tu byis pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o //üîΩphud pu ne lha gzhon nu'i gzugs so //
analyzed: kha cig tu byis pa'i gzugs su snang ba'o // phud pu ne lha gzhon nu'i gzugs so //
translated: He appears in the form of a youth in some places.üîΩA curl is a curl of hair.

original: lcang lo ni lcang lo dang gang ldan pa de lcang lo can te /
analyzed: lcang lo ni lcang lo dang gang ldan pa de lcang lo can te /
translated: A topknot with a curl is one who has a topknot with a curl.

original: ral pa can gyi gzugs kyis so //üîΩral pa ni thor tshugs gcig pa'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: ral pa can gyi gzugs kyis so // ral pa ni thor tshugs gcig pa'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: He appears in the form of one with matted locks.üîΩMatted locks is the form of one with a single braid.

original: munydza @77b ni mgo bo 'chang ba'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: munydza @77b ni mgo bo 'chang ba'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: A topknot with a crest is the form of one with a topknot and a crest.üîΩA topknot with a diadem is the form of one with a topknot and a diadem.

original: cod pan thogs ni cod pan ni dbu rgyan no //
analyzed: cod pan thogs ni cod pan ni dbu rgyan no //
translated: Wearing a crown means wearing a head ornament.

original: de dang gang ldan pa de ni cod pan thogs te ni ma la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: de dang gang ldan pa de ni cod pan thogs te ni ma la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: One who has that is wearing a crown. By the forms of mother and so forth.

original: gang dang gang gis 'dul ba'i gzugs can rnams la de dang de'i gzugs kyis de rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la so sor snang bar byed pa'i phyir na de ltar gsungs so //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'dul ba'i gzugs can rnams la de dang de'i gzugs kyis de rnams kyi sems kyi rgyud la so sor snang bar byed pa'i phyir na de ltar gsungs so //
translated: It is said that in whatever form one is to be tamed, by that form one appears to the mindstream of those to be tamed.

original: gdong lda gtsug phud lnga dang ldan //
analyzed: gdong lda gtsug phud lnga dang ldan //

original: zur phud lnga pa me tog thod //
analyzed: zur phud lnga pa me tog thod //

original: ces pa ni tshig bdun pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed pos ni bla ma'i man ngag gis dang po sangs rgyas kyi sbyor ba dang po'i bsgom khog de kho na las shes par bya zhing de yang bshad zin pa nyid kyis phyir na yang 'dir yang ma bshadüîΩdo // brtul zhugs che 'chang mun rdza can //

translated: Five locks of hair is half a seven-syllable line. By the guru's instruction, the first yoga and the first meditation should be understood from that alone. Since that has already been explained, it is not explained here again.üîΩHolding great discipline, a dark-skinned one,

original: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog / ces pa ni /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa brtul zhugs mchog / ces pa ni /
translated: pure conduct, supreme discipline,üîΩPure conduct is a seven-syllable line.

original: de la mun rdza zhes pa ni rtsa mun dza'i ske rags can gyi brtul zhugs 'dzin pa'i gzugs kyis brtul zhugs chen po pa ni la las phyag rgya lnga'i rgyan dang ldan par so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //

translated: The celibate is the one who appears individually as the BhagavƒÅn Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ in the form of a celibate, because of the cause of transformation that is the great practice of celibacy for limitless eons.

original: snang ngo // brtul zhugs mchog ni de yongs su 'os pa ste /
analyzed: snang ngo // brtul zhugs mchog ni de yongs su 'os pa ste /

original: nags khrod na gnas pa'i dngos po nyid kyis gang zhig skye ba ma lus drangs pa dang ldan zhing smyung bas chog pa de ni tshangs par spyod par bshad de /
analyzed: nags khrod na gnas pa'i dngos po nyid kyis gang zhig skye ba ma lus drangs pa dang ldan zhing smyung bas chog pa de ni tshangs par spyod par bshad de /

original: brtul zhugs mchog ni de nyid kyi phyir na brtul zhugs thams cad kyi nang na mchog tu gyur pa nyid kyi phyir na 'jam dpal kho na rigs te /

analyzed: bskal pa grangs med par ye shes kyi spyod pa la spyad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dka' thub mthar phyin dka' thub che // gtsang gnas dam pa goo ta ma //

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /

translated: He is a great ascetic because he is greatly engaged in

original: mya ngan 'das pa tshangs pa thob //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa tshangs pa thob //

original: ces pa ni /
analyzed: ces pa ni /

original: de la bram zhe ni //
analyzed: de la bram zhe ni //
translated: Here, the Brahman is

analyzed: dka' thub thos dang skye gnas te //

original: 'di dag bram ze byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag bram ze byed pa'o //

original: zhes so // gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid dus mtha' yas pa las skyes pas dka' thub dang ldan pa dang // yongs su mthar thug pa med pa'i thos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dang zhag pa med pa'i lam las skyes pa'i skye gnas kyi phyir te /

analyzed: de la gang bram ze'i bdag nyid rig pa ste 'di ni bcom ldan 'das 'jam dpal te /

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa'i rjes su brjod pa la bshad par grags te /

translated: Being trustworthy, he is trustworthy.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: pha dang grogs la sogs gcugs ni //
analyzed: pha dang grogs la sogs gcugs ni //
translated: Trust in father, friend, and so on,

original: dka' ba dga' yad byed mod kyi //
analyzed: dka' ba dga' yad byed mod kyi //
